translated: On the site of the brahman’s warm and moist abode, stones and sand are spread, and no grass or leaves grow.

original: ngas snying rje chen po dang rdzu 'phrul gyis byin gyis brlabs nas 'di lta bu'i byams snying rje chen pos rdzun pa'i sha zhes ming du btags nas khyed cag gis ro myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: ngas snying rje chen po dang rdzu 'phrul gyis byin gyis brlabs nas 'di lta bu'i byams snying rje chen pos rdzun pa'i sha zhes ming du btags nas khyed cag gis ro myong bar gyur to //
translated: I, with great compassion and supernatural powers, bless it, and with such great love and compassion, I designate it as false meat, and you experience its taste.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su sems can gyi sha za bzhin du ji ltar sh'akya'i sras zhes bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su sems can gyi sha za bzhin du ji ltar sh'akya'i sras zhes bya /
translated: After the Tathāgata’s nirvāṇa, how can you who eat the flesh of sentient beings be called sons of the Śākyas?

original: khyed cag shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed cag shes par gyis shig /
translated: You should know this!

original: skye bo sha za ba 'di dag blo sad nas bsam gtan thob pa ltar gyur na yang de dag thams cad srin por gyur nas las kyi 'bras bu rdzogs te nges par skye 'chi'i sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtshor ltung bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i slob ma ma yin
analyzed: skye bo sha za ba 'di dag blo sad nas bsam gtan thob pa ltar gyur na yang de dag thams cad srin por gyur nas las kyi 'bras bu rdzogs te nges par skye 'chi'i sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtshor ltung bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i slob ma ma yin
translated: Even if these flesh-eating people were to awaken and attain meditative concentration, they would all become rākṣasas. They would complete the results of their karma and certainly fall into the ocean of suffering of birth and death.

original: pa'i skye bo 'di dag phan tshun gsod pa dang / mid pa dang / za pa dag rgyun mi 'chad pa la 'di dag khams gsum las ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur; khyod kyis 'jig rten gyi skye bo dag ting nge 'dzin la slob tu 'jug pa na gzhan gsod pa'i rgyun chod cig dang /
analyzed: pa'i skye bo 'di dag phan tshun gsod pa dang / mid pa dang / za pa dag rgyun mi 'chad pa la 'di dag khams gsum las ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur; khyod kyis 'jig rten gyi skye bo dag ting nge 'dzin la slob tu 'jug pa na gzhan gsod pa'i rgyun chod cig dang /
translated: These people, who are not disciples of the Tathāgata, continuously kill, devour, and eat each other. How could they escape the three realms? When you teach worldly people to train in meditative concentration, you should stop them from killing others.

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag pa'i rnam par dag pa rmad du byung ba'i bslab pa gnyis pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag pa'i rnam par dag pa rmad du byung ba'i bslab pa gnyis pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata has said that this is the second marvelous training in the pure practices of the past blessed ones.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de'i phyir srog gcod pa rgyun mi gcod par ting nge @507a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir srog gcod pa rgyun mi gcod par ting nge @507a *//
translated: therefore, do not kill.

original: 'dzin la sbyong snyam pa ni /
analyzed: 'dzin la sbyong snyam pa ni /
translated: The thought I will train in the practice of non-grasping

original: dper na / skye bo 'ga' zhig rang gi lag pas rna ba bkab nas rang gi skad chen pos bos pa gzhan gyis thos par mi 'gyur snyam du sems pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na / skye bo 'ga' zhig rang gi lag pas rna ba bkab nas rang gi skad chen pos bos pa gzhan gyis thos par mi 'gyur snyam du sems pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: is like a person who, covering his ears with his hands, thinks that others will not hear his loud shouting.

original: 'di bzhin du 'chad pa las phyir zhing gsal bar gyur pa yod ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bzhin du 'chad pa las phyir zhing gsal bar gyur pa yod ces bya'o //
translated: It is said that this is like the explanation, but it becomes clearer.

original: dge slong rnam par dag pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpa' dag lam du 'gro pa na rtsva sngon po brdzi bar yang mi byed na /
analyzed: dge slong rnam par dag pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpa' dag lam du 'gro pa na rtsva sngon po brdzi bar yang mi byed na /
translated: Bhikṣus, moreover, when bodhisattvas travel on the road, they do not even trample on green grass,

original: lag pas gcad pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: lag pas gcad pa lta ci smos /
translated: let alone cut it with their hands.

original: snying rje chen po can gyi skye bo dag gis sems can gyi sha khrag ji ltar za bar rung /
analyzed: snying rje chen po can gyi skye bo dag gis sems can gyi sha khrag ji ltar za bar rung /
translated: How could compassionate people eat the flesh and blood of sentient beings?

original: gal te dge slong dag shar phyogs kyi srin bal dang / gos dar dang / phyogs 'di'i ko lpags kyi lha ma dang / slog pa dang / zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar dang / zhun mar la sogs pa'i bar bgo bar mi byed cing bza' bar mi phyed na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong dag shar phyogs kyi srin bal dang / gos dar dang / phyogs 'di'i ko lpags kyi lha ma dang / slog pa dang / zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar dang / zhun mar la sogs pa'i bar bgo bar mi byed cing bza' bar mi phyed na /
translated: If the monks do not share the cotton of the east, the silk of the south, the leather of this land, the shawls, the curds, the milk, the butter, the ghee, and so on,

original: dge slong 'di lta bu 'jig rten las nges par grol nas sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rdzogs par smin nas khams gsum du 'khor bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong 'di lta bu 'jig rten las nges par grol nas sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rdzogs par smin nas khams gsum du 'khor bar mi 'gyur /
translated: then these monks, being liberated from the world, will not cycle in the three realms, having completed and ripened the fruits of their past actions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de dag gi lus las byung ba dag longs spyad na /
analyzed: de dag gi lus las byung ba dag longs spyad na /
translated: If they consume what arises from their bodies,

original: de dag dang las kyi 'brel ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang las kyi 'brel ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be connected with karma.

original: da lta'i skye bo dag kyang sa las skyes pa'i 'bru rigs pa rgya dag zos pas rkang mthil sa la mi reg par ma gyur to //
analyzed: da lta'i skye bo dag kyang sa las skyes pa'i 'bru rigs pa rgya dag zos pas rkang mthil sa la mi reg par ma gyur to //
translated: Also, the people of today, by eating the various grains that grow from the earth, have not become ones whose feet do not touch the ground.

original: gdon mi za bar rang gi lus sems kyis sems can gyi lus dang / lus @507b las skyes pa'i dngos po bgo bar mi byed cing bza' bar mi byed na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar rang gi lus sems kyis sems can gyi lus dang / lus @507b las skyes pa'i dngos po bgo bar mi byed cing bza' bar mi byed na /
translated: “If you do not take the bodies of sentient beings and the things that arise from their bodies as your own body and food,

original: ngas skye bo de nges par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngas skye bo de nges par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then you will certainly be liberated.

original: zhes smra'o // ngas bshad pa 'di ltar 'chad na /
analyzed: zhes smra'o // ngas bshad pa 'di ltar 'chad na /
translated: ” If I explain it in this way,

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is the Buddha’s teaching.

original: 'di las gzhan du 'chad na /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan du 'chad na /
translated: If I explain it in any other way,

original: bdud kyis smras pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa yin no //
translated: it is the teaching of Māra.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad de dag gi sems ma byin len gyi dbang du ma song na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad de dag gi sems ma byin len gyi dbang du ma song na /
translated: if all the sentient beings in the world were not under the sway of the thought of stealing,

original: skye shi gnyis res mos ma rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dbang gis ltung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: skye shi gnyis res mos ma rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dbang gis ltung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: they would not fall under the sway of the endless cycle of birth and death.

original: khyod ting nge 'dzin la sbyong ba ni /
analyzed: khyod ting nge 'dzin la sbyong ba ni /
translated: You should practice samādhi

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'khrul pa dang 'bral ba'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'khrul pa dang 'bral ba'i phyir yin la /
translated: in order to be free from the confusion of afflictions.

original: ma byin len gyi sems ma bsal na yul dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin len gyi sems ma bsal na yul dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not eliminate the thought of stealing, you will not be free from objects.

original: ji ltar shes rab che zhing ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur kyang ma byin len ma spangs na nges par phyin ci log tu ltung bas rab rnams ni /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab che zhing ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur kyang ma byin len ma spangs na nges par phyin ci log tu ltung bas rab rnams ni /
translated: No matter how great one's wisdom and meditative concentration, if one does not give up stealing, one will certainly fall into error.

original: gdon bgegs su 'gyur /
analyzed: gdon bgegs su 'gyur /
translated: The best will become demons and obstructors.

original: 'bring 'dre phra mor 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bring 'dre phra mor 'gyur /
translated: The middling will become minor demons.

original: tha ma 'byung pos brlams pa'i skye bo dman par 'gyur ro //🔽log par spyod pa de dag la yang slob ma yod cing so so nas rang nyid bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob bo //
analyzed: tha ma 'byung pos brlams pa'i skye bo dman par 'gyur ro // log par spyod pa de dag la yang slob ma yod cing so so nas rang nyid bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob bo //
translated: The worst will become inferior beings possessed by spirits.

original: zhes zer ro //🔽nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes chos kyi snyigs ma'i dus su gdon log par spyod pa dag 'jig rten du 'ur zhing dar nas g-yo thabs nang du sbed cing dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bur brdzus te rang nyid ring mo zhig nas mi'i chos bla ma thob
analyzed: zhes zer ro // nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes chos kyi snyigs ma'i dus su gdon log par spyod pa dag 'jig rten du 'ur zhing dar nas g-yo thabs nang du sbed cing dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bur brdzus te rang nyid ring mo zhig nas mi'i chos bla ma thob
translated: Even among those who engage in these perverse practices, there are disciples, and each claims to have attained the unsurpassed state.

original: bo // zhe @508a *//
analyzed: bo // zhe @508a *//
translated: After my nirvana, in the age of degeneration of the Dharma, perverse demons will proliferate in the world, concealing their deceptions within, pretending to be spiritual friends, and claiming that they have long ago attained the Dharma that surpasses that of humans.

original: skye bo phal pa rnams bslus te de dag yid ches shing dran pa rmongs su bcug nas gang du sleb pa'i yul gyi khyim pa'i skye bo dag brlag cing 'thor bar byed do //
analyzed: skye bo phal pa rnams bslus te de dag yid ches shing dran pa rmongs su bcug nas gang du sleb pa'i yul gyi khyim pa'i skye bo dag brlag cing 'thor bar byed do //
translated: They deceive ordinary people, causing them to believe and be confused, and destroy and scatter the lay people of the country where they arrive.

original: ngas dge slong rnams la ljongs rgyu zhing bsod snyoms spyod cig ces bka' stsal pa ni /
analyzed: ngas dge slong rnams la ljongs rgyu zhing bsod snyoms spyod cig ces bka' stsal pa ni /
translated: I have instructed the monks to travel and practice alms begging.

original: de dag la ched du zhen pa spong zhing byang chub kyi lam bsgrub pa'i don du yin la /
analyzed: de dag la ched du zhen pa spong zhing byang chub kyi lam bsgrub pa'i don du yin la /
translated: This is for the purpose of abandoning attachment to them and accomplishing the path of enlightenment.

original: dge slong de dag rang nyid zas kyi g-yos mi byed par srog gi lhag ma 'tsho ba'i phyir du yin zhing srid pa gsum gyi mgron khang rnams su 'gro ba dang 'ong ba lan gcig byas shing song nas phyir mi ldog go /
analyzed: dge slong de dag rang nyid zas kyi g-yos mi byed par srog gi lhag ma 'tsho ba'i phyir du yin zhing srid pa gsum gyi mgron khang rnams su 'gro ba dang 'ong ba lan gcig byas shing song nas phyir mi ldog go /
translated: Those monks do not cook their own food, but in order to sustain their remaining life, they go to and come from the inns of the three existences once, and having gone, they do not return.

original: 'di la skye bo rkun po dag rdzun gyis nga'i gos dur smig gyon te de bzhin gshegs pa la brten nas rnyed pa don du gnyer te sdig pa sna tshogs pa byed bzhin du thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba nyid mi
analyzed: 'di la skye bo rkun po dag rdzun gyis nga'i gos dur smig gyon te de bzhin gshegs pa la brten nas rnyed pa don du gnyer te sdig pa sna tshogs pa byed bzhin du thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba nyid mi
translated: In this regard, there are some thieves who, wearing my Dharma robes, will falsely claim that they are relying on the Tathāgata. They will seek profit and pursue various kinds of evil, saying, ‘All of you must not take ordination in the Buddha’s teachings.’

original: dgos zhes smra zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong dag theg pa dman pa'o; ;zhes smad pa 'di ci zhig /
analyzed: dgos zhes smra zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong dag theg pa dman pa'o; ;zhes smad pa 'di ci zhig /
translated: They will slander bhikṣus who have received full ordination, saying, ‘They are of the Lesser Vehicle.’

original: tshul 'dis sems can grangs med pa dag 'khrul du bcug nas mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal bar ltung bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul 'dis sems can grangs med pa dag 'khrul du bcug nas mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal bar ltung bar byed do //
translated: By this method, they will confuse countless sentient beings and cause them to fall into the Avīci Hell.

original: gal te nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su dge slong gang dag sems bskyed nas nges par ting nge 'dzin la sbyong ba dag yod na /
analyzed: gal te nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su dge slong gang dag sems bskyed nas nges par ting nge 'dzin la sbyong ba dag yod na /
translated: After my nirvāṇa, if there are bhikṣus who arouse the mind of awakening and definitely apply themselves to samādhi,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du lus @508b la mar me gcig 'jugs pa dang / sor mo'i tshigs gcig sbar ba dang / yang na lus la spos 'bru gcig gis bsreg par nus na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs kyi mdun du lus @508b la mar me gcig 'jugs pa dang / sor mo'i tshigs gcig sbar ba dang / yang na lus la spos 'bru gcig gis bsreg par nus na /
translated: If one can offer a single lamp to the image of the Tathāgata, or burn a single finger or toe, or offer a single grain of incense on one’s body,

original: ngas de la skye ba thog ma med pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dus gcig tu zad nas 'jig rten las ring du gyur te zag pa thams cad dang gtan du 'bral bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: ngas de la skye ba thog ma med pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dus gcig tu zad nas 'jig rten las ring du gyur te zag pa thams cad dang gtan du 'bral bar 'gyur ro /
translated: then I declare that the results of actions from beginningless lifetimes will be exhausted all at once, and that person will be far from the world and will be forever free from all defilements.

original: zhes smra'o // bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam 'phral du mngon du ma gyur kyang skye bo de'i sems chos las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes smra'o // bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam 'phral du mngon du ma gyur kyang skye bo de'i sems chos las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the path to unsurpassed awakening is not realized immediately, the mind of that person will not turn away from the Dharma.

original: gal te 'di lta bu'i lus gtong ba'i rgyu cung zad la ma 'bad na zhi ba thob kyang nges par mi'i skye ba blangs nas skye ba snga ma'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'di lta bu'i lus gtong ba'i rgyu cung zad la ma 'bad na zhi ba thob kyang nges par mi'i skye ba blangs nas skye ba snga ma'i las kyi 'bras bu myong ngo //
translated: If one does not strive in the slightest for the cause of giving up such a body, even if one attains peace, one will definitely take a human birth and experience the results of actions from previous lives.

original: ngas sngar rta'i chag zos pa dang 'dra bar shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: ngas sngar rta'i chag zos pa dang 'dra bar shes par gyis shig /
translated: Understand that it is like the case of the horse’s tooth that I mentioned earlier.

original: khyod kyis 'jig rten gyi skye bo dag ting nge 'dzin la sbyong zhing slob tu 'jug pa na thog mar ma byin par len pa spongs shig dang / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag pa'i rnam par dag pa rmad du byung ba'i bslab pa gsum pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'jig rten gyi skye bo dag ting nge 'dzin la sbyong zhing slob tu 'jug pa na thog mar ma byin par len pa spongs shig dang / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag pa'i rnam par dag pa rmad du byung ba'i bslab pa gsum pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Thus-Come One has called this the third of the wondrous trainings in the pure precepts of the Buddhas of the three ages.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de'i phyir gal te ma byin par len pa ma spangs par ting nge 'dzin sbyong bar 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te ma byin par len pa ma spangs par ting nge 'dzin sbyong bar 'dod pa ni /
translated: if someone wants to enter meditative absorption but does not give up stealing,

original: dper na / skye bo 'ga' zhig pug pa brdol ba'i bum par chu blug pa dang 'dra ste //
analyzed: dper na / skye bo 'ga' zhig pug pa brdol ba'i bum par chu blug pa dang 'dra ste //
translated: it is like someone trying to pour water into a cracked vase.

original: de 'geng bar 'dod na bskal pa rdul snyed kyi bar du yang 'geng bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de 'geng bar 'dod na bskal pa rdul snyed kyi bar du yang 'geng bar mi nus so //
translated: Even if he tries for as many eons as there are motes of dust, he will not succeed.

original: gal te dge slong gang dag snam sbyor /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gang dag snam sbyor /
translated: If there are monks who wear patched robes,

original: @509a *// dang lhung bzed ma gtogs pa'i yo byad khru dang sor du longs pa tsam yang mi 'chang bar bsod snyoms kyi lhag ma sems can bkres pa rnams la sbyin pa btang zhing /
analyzed: @509a *// dang lhung bzed ma gtogs pa'i yo byad khru dang sor du longs pa tsam yang mi 'chang bar bsod snyoms kyi lhag ma sems can bkres pa rnams la sbyin pa btang zhing /
translated: They should not keep any possessions, not even something the size of a hand or a finger, except for their alms bowl. They should give the leftovers from their alms to hungry beings.

original: dge 'dun 'dus pa'i tshogs su thal mo sbyar zhing phyag 'tshal ba dang / rang la brdeg pa dang spyos pa dag yod na bsngags pa dang 'dra bar sems pa dang / gdon mi za bar lus sems yal bar dor nas lus kyi sha khrag rus pa sems can la gtad zhing /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus pa'i tshogs su thal mo sbyar zhing phyag 'tshal ba dang / rang la brdeg pa dang spyos pa dag yod na bsngags pa dang 'dra bar sems pa dang / gdon mi za bar lus sems yal bar dor nas lus kyi sha khrag rus pa sems can la gtad zhing /
translated: When they enter an assembly of the saṅgha, they should bow with palms joined, and if they are struck or scolded, they should think of it as praise. They should not abandon body and mind to the point of exhaustion, but should give their flesh, blood, and bones to sentient beings.🔽They should not explain the meaning of the Tathāgata’s implied teachings as the primary meaning, and thus not stray from the path as beginners.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po'i dgongs pa'i don gtso bor bshad nas las dang po la lam las gol bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mi byed pa de la de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag 'di lta bu dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ldem po'i dgongs pa'i don gtso bor bshad nas las dang po la lam las gol bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mi byed pa de la de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag 'di lta bu dag ni /
translated: The Tathāgata praises such people, saying:

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bsngags pa mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bsngags pa mdzad do //
translated: ‘These people will attain right samādhi.’

original: ngas bshad pa 'di ltar 'chad na /
analyzed: ngas bshad pa 'di ltar 'chad na /
translated: If I explain it in this way,

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is the Buddha’s teaching.

original: 'di las gzhan du 'chad na /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan du 'chad na /
translated: If I explain it in any other way,

original: bdud kyis smras pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa yin no //
translated: it is the teaching of Māra.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: da lta 'jig rten gyi rigs drug gi sems can thams cad kyis srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / log par g-yem pa mi byed /
analyzed: da lta 'jig rten gyi rigs drug gi sems can thams cad kyis srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / log par g-yem pa mi byed /
translated: all sentient beings of the six realms in the present world do not kill, do not take what is not given, and do not engage in sexual misconduct.

original: spyod pa 'di gsum spyod nus na yang gal te rdzun chen po smras na /
analyzed: spyod pa 'di gsum spyod nus na yang gal te rdzun chen po smras na /
translated: If they are able to practice these three actions but then speak a great lie,

original: ting nge 'dzin dag par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dag par byed mi nus so //
translated: they will be unable to purify their samādhi.

original: 'di la 'dod pa'i lta ba can gyi bdud du gyur nas @509b de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs stor ba'i phyir des ma thob pa thob bo //🔽zhes pa dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di la 'dod pa'i lta ba can gyi bdud du gyur nas @509b de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs stor ba'i phyir des ma thob pa thob bo // zhes pa dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs so //

original: zhes de skad du smra'o //
analyzed: zhes de skad du smra'o //

original: yang 'jig rten gyi rnyed bkur don du gnyer bas skye bo rnams kyi mdun du 'di ltar smra ste /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gyi rnyed bkur don du gnyer bas skye bo rnams kyi mdun du 'di ltar smra ste /

analyzed: bdag da lta rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / rang rgyal gyi theg pa pa dang /
translated: I am now abiding in the fruit of stream-entry, abiding in the fruit of once-returning, abiding in the fruit of non-returning, abiding in the fruit of arhatship, and in the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas,

analyzed: sa bcu pa ba dang / sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpar gyur to //

analyzed: zhes smras nas thams cad kyis phyag 'tshal ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba la re zhing mchod pa la zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having said this, they all bow down, and they long for the joining of palms and are attached to worship.

original: skye bo 'di ngan pa tha chad sangs rgyas kyi kyi go 'phang rlag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo 'di ngan pa tha chad sangs rgyas kyi kyi go 'phang rlag par byed pa'o //

original: dper na / skye bo 'ga' zhig gis shing ta la ral gris gcod pa ltar skye bo de dge rtsa chad nas shes pa dang nus pa med pa'i sdug bsngal gsum rgya mtshor phyir nas ji ltar gyur kyang mnyam par 'jog pa dang / ting nge 'dzin sgrub pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / skye bo 'ga' zhig gis shing ta la ral gris gcod pa ltar skye bo de dge rtsa chad nas shes pa dang nus pa med pa'i sdug bsngal gsum rgya mtshor phyir nas ji ltar gyur kyang mnyam par 'jog pa dang / ting nge 'dzin sgrub pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, just as a person cuts a palm tree with a sword, so too, when a person severs the roots of virtue, they become devoid of cognition and ability, and then, after falling into the ocean of the three kinds of suffering, no matter what happens, they will not be able to enter into meditative concentration or to achieve meditative concentration.

original: zhes sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal to //
translated: This is what the Buddha has said.

original: nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / dgra bcom pa rnams gdul bya de dag dang 'tsham pa'i lus kyis chos kyi snyigs ma'i dus su skye ba blangs te sna tshogs pa'i @510a *//
analyzed: nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / dgra bcom pa rnams gdul bya de dag dang 'tsham pa'i lus kyis chos kyi snyigs ma'i dus su skye ba blangs te sna tshogs pa'i @510a *//
translated: After I have passed into nirvāṇa, all the bodhisattvas and arhats will take birth in the degenerate age, in bodies suitable for those to be trained, and will emanate various forms.

original: gzugs su sprul te 'khor bar 'khor ba rnams grol bar byed do //
analyzed: gzugs su sprul te 'khor bar 'khor ba rnams grol bar byed do //
translated: They will liberate those who are wandering in saṃsāra.

original: 'di la dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: 'di la dge sbyong ngam /
translated: Here, there are no śramaṇas or

original: skye bo phal pa dang / blon po chen po'i rigs dang / rgyal rigs dang / sna chen po la gtogs pa'i rigs dang / bu dang bu mo yang rung /
analyzed: skye bo phal pa dang / blon po chen po'i rigs dang / rgyal rigs dang / sna chen po la gtogs pa'i rigs dang / bu dang bu mo yang rung /
translated: They may be ordinary people, or of the class of great ministers, or of the class of kings, or of the class of great officials, or of the class of sons and daughters.

original: bud med 'phyon ma dang / yug sa mo dang / gang dag 'khrig pa spyod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / bshan pa dang / tshong pa dag gi gzugs su sprul nas de dag dang lhan cig tu mthun par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la bsngags pa brjod nas de dag gi lus sems ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bar byed kyi /
analyzed: bud med 'phyon ma dang / yug sa mo dang / gang dag 'khrig pa spyod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / bshan pa dang / tshong pa dag gi gzugs su sprul nas de dag dang lhan cig tu mthun par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la bsngags pa brjod nas de dag gi lus sems ting nge 'dzin la sbyor bar byed kyi /
translated: They may be prostitutes, or widows, or those who engage in sexual activity, or thieves, or butchers, or merchants. Having emanated in the form of those who engage in sexual activity, having praised the vehicle of the Buddha, they cause their bodies and minds to be applied to meditative stabilization.

original: ci nas kyang rang nyid nges par byang chub sems dpa' dang / nges par dgra bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: ci nas kyang rang nyid nges par byang chub sems dpa' dang / nges par dgra bcom pa yin no //
translated: They are definitely bodhisattvas, and they are definitely arhats.

original: zhes sangs rgyas kyi gsung zab mo sgrog cing las dang po pa rnams kyi mdun du ci bder smra bar mi byed do //
analyzed: zhes sangs rgyas kyi gsung zab mo sgrog cing las dang po pa rnams kyi mdun du ci bder smra bar mi byed do //

original: che 'pho ba na lkog tu tshul de kha chem gyi tshul du bsnyad par byed pa dag ni /
analyzed: che 'pho ba na lkog tu tshul de kha chem gyi tshul du bsnyad par byed pa dag ni /

original: yod do // 'di lta bu dag ni; sems can thams cad rmongs su bcug nas spyod pa 'khrug pa'i rdzun chen po smra bar ci zhig 'gyur /
analyzed: yod do // 'di lta bu dag ni; sems can thams cad rmongs su bcug nas spyod pa 'khrug pa'i rdzun chen po smra bar ci zhig 'gyur /
translated: What is the point of such people, who deceive all sentient beings and speak great lies that disturb people’s behavior?

original: khyod kyis 'jig rten gyi skye bo ting nge 'dzin la sbyong zhing slob tu 'jug pa na thog mar rdzun chen po smra ba spongs shig dang / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag pa'i rnam par dag pa rmad du byung @510b ba'i bslab pa bzhi pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'jig rten gyi skye bo ting nge 'dzin la sbyong zhing slob tu 'jug pa na thog mar rdzun chen po smra ba spongs shig dang / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag pa'i rnam par dag pa rmad du byung @510b ba'i bslab pa bzhi pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: When you teach people in the world to train in meditative concentration, first get rid of your great lies. The Tathāgata has taught this as the fourth marvelous training in the pure conduct of the former blessed ones.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de'i phyir gal te rdzun chen po smra ba ma spangs na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rdzun chen po smra ba ma spangs na /
translated: if you do not get rid of your great lies,

analyzed: dper na / mi'i phyi sa la tsandan ltar bcos pa la dri bzang gtan nas 'byung mi srid ba dang 'dra'o //

original: ngas dge slong rnams la yang dag pa'i sems kyis tshogs kyi nang du gdams pa na bslab pa rnam pa bzhi nas brtsams te bya ba dang spyod pa gang la yang rdzun dang g-yo sgyu bya mi rung zhes bka' stsal pa bzhin du dang nyid ma'i chos bla🔽ma thob bo //
analyzed: ngas dge slong rnams la yang dag pa'i sems kyis tshogs kyi nang du gdams pa na bslab pa rnam pa bzhi nas brtsams te bya ba dang spyod pa gang la yang rdzun dang g-yo sgyu bya mi rung zhes bka' stsal pa bzhin du dang nyid ma'i chos bla ma thob bo //
translated: I have told the monks in the assembly with a pure mind that one should not lie or deceive in any action or behavior, beginning with the four precepts.🔽How can one pretend to be a Dharma master without having obtained the precepts?

original: zhes spyoms na ji ltar rung /
analyzed: zhes spyoms na ji ltar rung /
translated: How can one pretend to be a Dharma master without having obtained the precepts?🔽For example, if a poor person were to boast,

analyzed: dper na / mi dbul pos rang nyid rgyal po yin no // zhes snyems par byed na /

analyzed: gsod pa'i nyes pa la thug cing thar par mi nus na chos kyi rgyal po ltar brdzus shing 'chos par ji ltar rung /

original: brten pa'i gnas yang dag pa ma yin na /
analyzed: brten pa'i gnas yang dag pa ma yin na /
translated: If the basis of reliance is not correct,

analyzed: 'bras bu brtan por mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'dis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la re na skye bo 'ga' zhig rang gi lte ba la so 'debs pa dang 'dra bar de ltar su zhig nus /

analyzed: nam du yang bdud kyi las mi 'byung ngo //

analyzed: ngas skye ba de la byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'du shes rdzogs par 'grub nus so //

original: zhes bsngags pa mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bsngags pa mdzad do //

original: ngas bshad pa 'di ltar 'chad na /
analyzed: ngas bshad pa 'di ltar 'chad na /
translated: If I explain in this way,

analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa yin no //

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

analyzed: khyod kyis sems bsdu ba'i tshul dris pas /
translated: you asked about the way to gather the mind.

analyzed: ngas khyod la thog mar ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas sgo dam pa la brtson pas sbyangs te byang chub sems dpa'i lam tshol bar 'dod na nges par thog ma nyid bslab pa 'di bzhi ji ltar 'khyags pa dang ba mo ltar dri ma med par
translated: If you wish to enter into samādhi and strive to train in the excellent door, seeking the bodhisattva path, you must first guard these four trainings without fault, like ice or frost.

analyzed: srungs shig / 'di ltar na nyes spyod kyi yan lag sna tshogs pa dag rang nyid 'phel zhing skye bar mi 'gyur na /

analyzed: yid kyi rnam gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi gang gi rjes su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: then how could the three mental and four verbal [branches] arise?

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

analyzed: bsdam par bya ba rnam pa 'di bzhi gal te ma btang na sems gzugs dri ro reg bya rnams dang 'bral ba med pas na /

analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa sna tshogs gang las skye /
translated: From what do the various karmic obscurations arise?

original: gal te sngon gyi bag chags sel bar ma nus na /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi bag chags sel bar ma nus na /
translated: If you are unable to dispel the latent tendencies of the past,

translated: The Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa, which is invisible, manifests from the dharmakāya, which is devoid of substance, and sits upon a jeweled lotus seat.

original: re zhig da lta khyod skye ba sngan mar bu mo ma tingga dang bskal pa mang por 'brel bas 'dod cing gces pas sngon gyi bag chags bskal pa gcig nyid dang / tshe rabs gcig nyid ma yin pa la ngas lan gcig gsungs pa tsam gyis 'dod chags kyi sems rnam par dag nas dgra bcom par gyur to //

translated: Because of your past latent propensities, not just one eon or one lifetime, by my saying just once, ‘I desire you,’ your mind of desire was purified and you became an arhat.”

original: de yang 'dod chags can gyi bud med yin zhing slob cing sbyong ba'i sems med pa la rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus mi mngon par byin gyis brlabs pas myur du mi slob par gyur na /
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags can gyi bud med yin zhing slob cing sbyong ba'i sems med pa la rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus mi mngon par byin gyis brlabs pas myur du mi slob par gyur na /
translated: “Moreover, since you were a lustful woman and had no mind to train, through the power of my miraculous blessing you quickly became a nonlearner.

original: khyed cag nyan thos rnams bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po don du gnyer na sangs rgyas thob par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul yod dam /
analyzed: khyed cag nyan thos rnams bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po don du gnyer na sangs rgyas thob par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul yod dam /

analyzed: dper na / rdul rlung gi rdzi phyogs dang mthun par 'phyar ba ltar dka' ba'i gnas ci zhig yod /
translated: For example, what difficult point is there in blowing dust that is in the direction of the wind?”

analyzed: gal te chos kyi snyigs ma'i tshe dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga la 'jug par 'dod pa dag yod na /

analyzed: des thog mar dge slong gi sdom pa rnam par dag pa bsrung dgos /

analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar sdom pa rnam dag dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong mchog slob dpon du bsten /
translated: Therefore, they must definitely rely on a teacher who is a supreme renunciant and who possesses pure vows.

original: gal te sdom pa rnam par dag pa dang ma 'phrad na de dag gi @512a *//
analyzed: gal te sdom pa rnam par dag pa dang ma 'phrad na de dag gi @512a *//

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi brtul zhugs ji ltar yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sdom pa blangs pa'i rjes su gos gsar pa gyon /
translated: After taking the vows, put on new clothes,

original: te de'i spyi gtsug tu phog par bsgom mo //
analyzed: te de'i spyi gtsug tu phog par bsgom mo //
translated: and it will descend upon the crown of his head.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽snyigs ma'i dus der sdom pa rnam dag dang ldan pa'i dge slong ngam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo / snyigs ma'i dus der sdom pa rnam dag dang ldan pa'i dge slong ngam /
translated: Ānanda,

original: dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma'am /

translated: who enter the maṇḍala after making the bodhisattva's aspiration, and who wash themselves every time they enter and leave, and who meditate on this in the six periods of the day,

analyzed: nas 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis mi nyal bar zhag bdun phrag gsum du bsgrubs na /
translated: and if they practice in this way without sleeping for twenty-one days,

analyzed: nga de'i mdun du 'ong zhing zhal dngos su bstan te spyi bor phyag bzhag nas dbugs dbyung zhing de'i blo rgyas par byed do // kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: I will come before them, reveal my face, place my hand on their heads, comfort them, and expand their minds.🔽Ānanda said to the Buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: World-Honored One,

original: bdag de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i thugs rje'i bka' drin las blo phye ste lam @512b bsgoms nas mi slob pa'i go 'phang 'grub pa'i tshul rang nyid mi 'khrul bar shes so //

translated: I understand that through the Tathagata's unsurpassed compassion, one's mind is opened, one cultivates the path, and one attains the stage of no more learning.

analyzed: chos kyi snyigs ma'i dus su sgom pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhengs par 'dod na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said to Ananda,

analyzed: gal te snyigs ma'i dus kyi skye bos dkyil 'khor bzhengs par 'dod na /

analyzed: thog mar gangs kyi ri'i nye 'dabs su gnas pa'i ba dkar mo stobs dang ldan pa tshol cig /

analyzed: lci ba de blangs te tsandan dang bsres nas sa la byug /

original: gangs kyi phyugs ma yin na /
analyzed: gangs kyi phyugs ma yin na /
translated: If it is not the dung of a snow mountain cow,

original: de'i lci ba dri ngan zhing mi gtsang bas sa la byug tu mi rung /
analyzed: de'i lci ba dri ngan zhing mi gtsang bas sa la byug tu mi rung /

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /

analyzed: thang bde ba nas sa la khru lnga tsam brkos te 'og gi sa ser po blangs nas tsandan /

analyzed: aa ga ru / shi la / du ru ka /
translated: śrī,🔽durva,🔽kumkuma,

analyzed: gur gum; ru rta /
translated: ruta,🔽śaṅkha,

analyzed: spang rgyan / spang spos /

translated: Grind those ten into powder, mix it with clay, smear it on the ground of the maṇḍala, and make an eight-sided maṇḍala of thirteen cubits.

original: dkyil 'khor dbus su gser ram /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dbus su gser ram /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, make a square platform of gold,🔽silver, copper,

original: dngul lam / zangs sam /
analyzed: dngul lam / zangs sam /

original: shing las byas pa'i padma dang / de'i steng du lhung bzed bzhag ste lhung bzed kyi @513a *//
analyzed: shing las byas pa'i padma dang / de'i steng du lhung bzed bzhag ste lhung bzed kyi @513a *//
translated: A lotus made of wood, and on top of that the alms-bowl,

original: nang du ston zla 'bring po'i zil ba'i chu blugs nas ji ltar rnyed cing 'os pa'i lo ma dang bcas pa'i me tog gzugs so //
analyzed: nang du ston zla 'bring po'i zil ba'i chu blugs nas ji ltar rnyed cing 'os pa'i lo ma dang bcas pa'i me tog gzugs so //
translated: in the alms-bowl water with the dew of the middle autumn month, and with leaves and flowers as much as one can get.

analyzed: yang me long zlum po brgyad rang rang gi gnas su bzhag ste me tog dang ldan pa'i lhung bzed la bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Again, eight round mirrors, each in its place, and one should circumambulate the alms-bowl with the flowers.

original: me long gi mthar me tog padma bcu drug dang / spos phor bcu drug spel te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: me long gi mthar me tog padma bcu drug dang / spos phor bcu drug spel te gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: spos phor gyi nang du aa ga ru 'ba' gzhig bsreg cing me lce mi 'bar bar bya'o //
translated: In the incense-burners, only powdered aloeswood should be burned, so that the flames do not flare up.

original: ba dkar mo'i 'o ma snod bcu drug tu blug go /
analyzed: ba dkar mo'i 'o ma snod bcu drug tu blug go /

original: 'o ma'i lde gu dang / ka ra btab pa'i snum 'khur dang / 'o spris dang / dug dang ma 'dres pa'i sman spos dang / sprang rtsis spags pa'i sga dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi rnams cha bcu drug tu byas te me tog gi mthar bskor te sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma'i lde gu dang / ka ra btab pa'i snum 'khur dang / 'o spris dang / dug dang ma 'dres pa'i sman spos dang / sprang rtsis spags pa'i sga dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsi rnams cha bcu drug tu byas te me tog gi mthar bskor te sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad la mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should prepare sixteen parts of milk gruel, oil-cake with sugar, cream, medicine incense not mixed with poison, fodder mixed with honey, ghee, and honey. Having made these sixteen parts, one should surround them with flowers and make offerings to all the Buddhas and great Bodhisattvas.

original: nyin gung dang mtshan gung gi dus su sbrang rtsi bre byed dang / mar khyor ba gsum sta gon byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du spos phor chung ngu gzhag /
analyzed: nyin gung dang mtshan gung gi dus su sbrang rtsi bre byed dang / mar khyor ba gsum sta gon byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du spos phor chung ngu gzhag /
translated: At noon and midnight, having prepared a measure of honey and three spoonfuls of ghee, one should place a small incense burner in front of the mandala.

original: dri zhim po'i dur ba'i me la chu skol te khrus gsol nas me de gtsang ma byas te mar dang sprang rtsi bsregs pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: dri zhim po'i dur ba'i me la chu skol te khrus gsol nas me de gtsang ma byas te mar dang sprang rtsi bsregs pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mchod par bya'o //
translated: Having boiled water over a fragrant wood fire, one should perform the ablutions. Having purified the fire, one should make offerings to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas by burning the ghee and honey.

original: phyi'i phyogs bzhir ba dang me tog gi phyang phrul bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i phyogs bzhir ba dang me tog gi phyang phrul bya'o //
translated: One should hang garlands of flowers and incense in the four directions outside.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i nang gi phyogs bzhir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa @513b dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sku brnyan bzhugs su gsol //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa'i nang gi phyogs bzhir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa @513b dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sku brnyan bzhugs su gsol //
translated: In the four directions inside the maṇḍala house, one should install images of all the tathāgatas of the ten directions and bodhisattvas.

original: dbus su rnam par snang mdzad /
analyzed: dbus su rnam par snang mdzad /
translated: In the center, Vairocana,

original: sh'akya thub pa /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa /

original: byams pa / mi 'khrugs pa /
analyzed: byams pa / mi 'khrugs pa /

analyzed: 'od dpag med rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa spyan ras gzigs la sogs pa'i sku brnyan dang / g-yas g-yon du byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po sogs dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / aa tstshashma dang /
translated: and Amitābha, and images of those endowed with great magical power, such as Avalokiteśvara, and so on, and on the right and left sides, the bodhisattvas Vajragarbha and so on, Śakra, Brahmā, Acyuta,

original: dbyug sngon can dang / kunda li dang / bhri ku ti dang / rgyal chen bzhi dang / log 'dren rnams sgo'i g-yas g-yon dus brengs te dgod /
analyzed: dbyug sngon can dang / kunda li dang / bhri ku ti dang / rgyal chen bzhi dang / log 'dren rnams sgo'i g-yas g-yon dus brengs te dgod /
translated: Nīladaṇḍa, Kuṇḍalī, Bhṛkuṭī, the Four Great Kings, and the evil ones should be arranged in the right and left doors.

original: yang me long brgyad steng nas 'od tu phyogs par btags te dkyil 'khor gyi nang gi me long dang thad kar 'od phan tshun du phog par byas te gzugs brnyan dag brtsegs mar 'char du bcug /
analyzed: yang me long brgyad steng nas 'od tu phyogs par btags te dkyil 'khor gyi nang gi me long dang thad kar 'od phan tshun du phog par byas te gzugs brnyan dag brtsegs mar 'char du bcug /
translated: Again, eight mirrors are placed facing upward. The mirrors inside the maṇḍala are placed so that the light from the mirrors facing upward mutually strikes each other, causing the reflections to appear in layers.

original: zhag bdun phrag dang po la rtse gcig tu phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyis mtshan nas brjod cing phyag 'tshal nas dus drug drug tu sngags bzla zhing bskor ba byed la sems rtse gcig pas chos spyod bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun phrag dang po la rtse gcig tu phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyis mtshan nas brjod cing phyag 'tshal nas dus drug drug tu sngags bzla zhing bskor ba byed la sems rtse gcig pas chos spyod bya'o //
translated: In the first week, one-pointedly recite the names of the tathāgatas of the ten directions, the great bodhisattvas, and the arhats. Prostrate, recite the mantra, and circumambulate in the six periods.

original: dus re rer yang rgyun ma chad par lan brgya rtsa brgyad re bya'o //
analyzed: dus re rer yang rgyun ma chad par lan brgya rtsa brgyad re bya'o //
translated: In each period, one should do it one hundred and eight times without interruption.

original: zhag bdun phrag gnyis par sems rtse gcig pas byang chub sems dpa'i smon pa'i sems rgyun ma chad par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun phrag gnyis par sems rtse gcig pas byang chub sems dpa'i smon pa'i sems rgyun ma chad par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In the second week, one should generate the bodhisattva aspirational mind continuously with a one-pointed mind.

original: smon sems kyi bslab bya ngas sngar 'dul ba'i sde snod las gsal bar bstan to //🔽zhag bdun phrag @514a *//
analyzed: smon sems kyi bslab bya ngas sngar 'dul ba'i sde snod las gsal bar bstan to // zhag bdun phrag @514a *//
translated: I have already clearly explained the precepts of the aspiration mind in the Vinaya Piṭaka.

analyzed: gsum pa la dus bcu gnyis su rgyun gcig gis gdugs dkar po can gyi sngags bzla bar bya'o //
translated: In the third week, one should recite the mantra of Sitātapatrā in one session for twelve periods.

original: zhag bdun pa la phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dus gcig tu mngon sum du byon te me long gi 'od zer phog pa der phyag spyi bor bzhag ma thag tu ting nge 'dzin la gzhol bas /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa la phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dus gcig tu mngon sum du byon te me long gi 'od zer phog pa der phyag spyi bor bzhag ma thag tu ting nge 'dzin la gzhol bas /
translated: In the seventh week, the tathāgatas of the ten directions will all come at the same time and appear in person. As soon as they place their hands on the head of the one struck by the light rays of the mirror, he will immediately enter into samādhi.

original: 'di lta bu'i snyigs ma'i dus bee d'urya ltar dag par byed nus so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i snyigs ma'i dus bee d'urya ltar dag par byed nus so //
translated: In this degenerate age, he will be able to purify himself like a vaiḍūrya.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gal te dge slong gi sdom pa blangs pa'i mkhan po dang / 'dus pa'i tshogs dge slong bcu'i nang nas tshul khrims ma dag pa gcig yod na 'di lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub pa phal cher 'grub par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gi sdom pa blangs pa'i mkhan po dang / 'dus pa'i tshogs dge slong bcu'i nang nas tshul khrims ma dag pa gcig yod na 'di lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub pa phal cher 'grub par mi 'gyur /
translated: if among the ten bhikṣus who have taken the bhikṣu precepts and are assembled, there is even one with impure morality, then this kind of maṇḍala practice will mostly not be accomplished.

original: zhag bdun phrag gsum gyi rjes su drang zhing mi g-yo bar 'dug ste zhag brgya song ba na /
analyzed: zhag bdun phrag gsum gyi rjes su drang zhing mi g-yo bar 'dug ste zhag brgya song ba na /
translated: After three weeks, the body becomes straight and still. After one hundred days,

original: dbang po rnon po'i rigs yin na stan dang ma bral bar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i rigs yin na stan dang ma bral bar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro /
translated: if the person is of sharp faculties, he or she will attain the fruit of stream entry without ever leaving the seat.

original: des lus sems khyad par du 'phags pa'i go 'phang ma thob kyang sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang thob la mi bslu bas yid gnyis ma byed cig /🔽khyod kyis dris pa'i dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i tshul ni /
analyzed: des lus sems khyad par du 'phags pa'i go 'phang ma thob kyang sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang thob la mi bslu bas yid gnyis ma byed cig / khyod kyis dris pa'i dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i tshul ni /
translated: Even if the person does not attain a superior state of body and mind, since the attainment of buddhahood is certain, do not have any doubts.

original: 'di ltar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ro //
translated: The way to accomplish the maṇḍala that you have asked about is as follows.

original: kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal nas gsol ba bdag rab tu byung ba tshun chad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gces par bskyangs pas mang du thos pa la 'bad pa las chos nyid 'dus ma byas mngon du byed ma nus so //
analyzed: kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal nas gsol ba bdag rab tu byung ba tshun chad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gces par bskyangs pas mang du thos pa la 'bad pa las chos nyid 'dus ma byas mngon du byed ma nus so //
translated: Ānanda bowed to the feet of the Bhagavān and said, “Since I went forth, the Bhagavān has cherished me, and because of my diligence in learning much, I have not been able to actualize the unconditioned nature of phenomena.

original: tshangs pa'i @514b gdams ngag phyin log gi 'ching ba dang 'phrad nas sems kyis gsal bar shes kyang rang rang deb na du ma gyur pas 'jam pa'i dbyangs dang 'phrad pa las bdag rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i @514b gdams ngag phyin log gi 'ching ba dang 'phrad nas sems kyis gsal bar shes kyang rang rang deb na du ma gyur pas 'jam pa'i dbyangs dang 'phrad pa las bdag rnam par grol lo //
translated: Having encountered the bondage of the wrong instructions of Brahma, although clearly understood by the mind, they did not become individual books, so I was liberated from meeting Manjushri.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor nas byung ba'i rig sngags kyis mi mngon par bskyab par mdzad kyang dngos po ma thos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor nas byung ba'i rig sngags kyis mi mngon par bskyab par mdzad kyang dngos po ma thos so //
translated: Although protected by the knowledge mantra that arose from the crown of the Tathagata, the matter was not heard.

original: brtse ba chen pos slar yang gsal bar gsungs nas 'dus pa 'di'i slob pa thams cad skyong zhing skyob pa dang / yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi 'khor ba'i skye bo phal pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gsang bas lus sems rnam par grol ba thob par mdzad du gsol zhes gsol pa dang /
analyzed: brtse ba chen pos slar yang gsal bar gsungs nas 'dus pa 'di'i slob pa thams cad skyong zhing skyob pa dang / yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi 'khor ba'i skye bo phal pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gsang bas lus sems rnam par grol ba thob par mdzad du gsol zhes gsol pa dang /
translated: With great compassion, he again spoke clearly, saying, Protect and guard all the disciples of this assembly, and in the future, up to the ordinary beings of samsara, may they attain liberation of body and mind through the secret speech of the Tathagata.🔽

original: de'i tshe 'dus pa thams cad so so nas phyag 'tshal zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi gsang ba zab mo mnyan pa don du gnyer zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dus pa thams cad so so nas phyag 'tshal zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi gsang ba zab mo mnyan pa don du gnyer zhing 'dug go /
translated: At that time, all those assembled bowed to him and sat down, each one intent on listening to the profound secret of the Tathāgata’s speech.🔽At that time, from the uṣṇīṣa of the Blessed One, hundreds of precious light rays radiated upward, and from within the light rays, a thousand-petaled precious lotus appeared.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi gtsug tor nas rin po che'i 'od zer brgya phrag steng du 'phro zhing 'od zer gyi nang nas rin po che'i padma 'dab ma stong dang ldan pa gsal bar byung ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku rin po che'i padma de🔽la bzhugs nas gtsug tor nas rin po che'i 'od zer brgya phrag bcu 'phros shing 'od zer de dag la gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed bcu'i gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje dngos su bstan te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi gtsug tor nas rin po che'i 'od zer brgya phrag steng du 'phro zhing 'od zer gyi nang nas rin po che'i padma 'dab ma stong dang ldan pa gsal bar byung ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku rin po che'i padma de la bzhugs nas gtsug tor nas rin po che'i 'od zer brgya phrag bcu 'phros shing 'od zer de dag la gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed bcu'i gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje dngos su bstan te /
translated: The emanation of the Tathāgata, the precious lotus,🔽sat on that lotus, and from the uṣṇīṣa, ten hundred precious light rays radiated, and on those light rays, the lords of the secret, the Vajrapāṇis, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, were actually revealed.

original: ri bo 'des shing rdo rje bsnams pa nam mkha'i bar du khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: ri bo 'des shing rdo rje bsnams pa nam mkha'i bar du khyab par gyur to //
translated: Holding vajras, they filled the sky.

original: thams cad nam mkha' la bltas te skrag pa @515a *//
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha' la bltas te skrag pa @515a *//
translated: All of them looked up into the sky and were terrified.

original: dang dga' ba'i sems lhan cig tu skyabs nas de bzhin gshegs pa la skyes tshol zhing rtse gzig pa'i sems kyis sangs rgyas kyi gsang sngags kyi tshig stsol pa la mnyan cing 'dug go /
analyzed: dang dga' ba'i sems lhan cig tu skyabs nas de bzhin gshegs pa la skyes tshol zhing rtse gzig pa'i sems kyis sangs rgyas kyi gsang sngags kyi tshig stsol pa la mnyan cing 'dug go /
translated: and with a mind of joy and faith, they listened to the request for the secret mantra words of the Buddha with a mind of playfulness and seeking.

original: gtsug tor bltar mi mngon pa'i mtshan gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas gsang sngags kyi tshig 'di dag bka' stsal to //

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams snying po'i sngags 'di'i rjes su 'brangs pas phyogs bcu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten nas spyod lam rnam pa bzhis bnyen bkur yid bzhin du sgrub nus shing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs su chos kyi

translated: If one were to recite the benefits of this mantra of the white parasol that emerged from the crown of the Tathāgata continuously throughout the day without a break,

original: gza' dang rgyu skar drag po rnams dang bcas pa lha 'dres thams cad kyis gnod par brtsams kyang skye bo de la tshugs par mi 'gyur /🔽log 'dren la @520a *//

original: sogs pa dang gshin rje'i rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad de'i bka' drin mnos te rtag tu srung zhing skyob par 'gyur /🔽kun dga' bo /

translated: If sentient beings are distracted and agitated and their minds do not rest in samādhi, but they remember with their minds and recite with their speech, those vajra families will always follow them, protect them, and guard them.

analyzed: de lta bu'i rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems brtan por gyur pa dag smos ci dgos /

original: skye bo de dus de nyid du bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed brgyad khri bzhi stong gi las dren te thams cad gsal bar nus shing the tshom med par 'gyur ro //

translated: At that time, he will be able to recall the karma of eighty-four thousand eons, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, and will be able to illuminate everything without doubt.

original: thog ma'i bskal pa nas phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du skye ba thams cad du nam du yang gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / sprul po dang / lus srul po dang / grul bum dang / sha za dang / yi dvags la sogs pa'i @520b gzugs dang /

translated: From the beginning of the eon until the end, in all his births, he will never be born in an evil state such as that of a yakṣa, rākṣasa, pūtana, kaṭapūtana, kumbhāṇḍa, piśāca, or preta,

analyzed: gzugs med dang / 'du shes can dang / 'du shes med pa'i gnas ngan par skye bar mi 'gyur /

translated: Son of good family, if those who recite, chant, write, or cause to be written, or who uphold, preserve, and honor and make offerings to this dhāraṇī

translated: For all of those eons, they will not be born in poverty, in low-caste families, or in places lacking happiness.

original: pa'i bskal pa rnams su rtag par sangs rgyas thams cad kyi drung du skye zhing dpag tu med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i bskal pa rnams su rtag par sangs rgyas thams cad kyi drung du skye zhing dpag tu med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: “All the thus-gone ones in the ten directions will bestow upon those beings all the splendor of goodness that they themselves have created. For as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, beyond any count, beyond any expression, they will always be born in the presence of all the buddhas and will possess immeasurable heaps of merit.

original: aa kra ku'i khyim ltar lhan cig tu 'brel nas nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa kra ku'i khyim ltar lhan cig tu 'brel nas nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir sdom pa nyams pa yang sdom pa rnams par dag par 'gyur //

analyzed: sdom pa ma thob pa yang sdom pa thob par 'gyur /

analyzed: brtson pa dang mi ldan pa yang brtson pa dang ldan par 'gyur /

analyzed: shes rab dang mi ldan pa yang shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur /

analyzed: shes rab ma byas pa yang smyung ba byas par 'gyur ro //

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag sngags 'di bzlas shing 'dzin pa na gal te ma bzung ba'i skabs su sdom pa nyams na sngags @521a *//

translated: Even if they drink alcohol, eat the five pungent vegetables such as garlic, or various impure foods, all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, vajra messengers, celestial sages, gods,

analyzed: 'byung po dag gis de dag la skyon du mi blta'o //
translated: The spirits will not see them as flawed.

original: gal te mi gtsang ba'i gos hrul po gyon nas zhag gcig gnas pa dang dus gcig 'gro ba thams cad la rnam par dag pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur /

translated: Even if one does not perform the maṇḍala, does not perform the rite, and does not practice the path, if one holds and recites this mantra, one will obtain the benefits as if one were engaged in the maṇḍala and practicing the path.

translated: If one has committed the five heinous crimes, or if one has committed the four or eight acts that are the basis for downfall of a fully ordained monk or nun, by reciting this mantra all such grave negative karma will be exhausted, like a pile of sand blown away by a strong wind, leaving not even a speck behind.

original: kun dga' bo /
