translated: I will ensure that this person's activities are accomplished as wished.

original: de nas kun dga' bos stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas kun dga' bos stan las langs te /
translated: Then Ānanda rose from his seat,🔽bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas gsol pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas gsol pa /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag cag blun zhing rtul ba'i phyir mang du thos pa la gzhol bas sems zag pa thams cad dang bral ba don du mi gnyer la /
analyzed: bdag cag blun zhing rtul ba'i phyir mang du thos pa la gzhol bas sems zag pa thams cad dang bral ba don du mi gnyer la /
translated: Because we are foolish and dull, we are devoted to learning much and do not strive for the mind free from all defilements.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtse bas gdams pa'i bka' drin las yang dag pa'i lam la brtson pa thob nas lus sems la phan pa dang bde bas tshim par gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtse bas gdams pa'i bka' drin las yang dag pa'i lam la brtson pa thob nas lus sems la phan pa dang bde bas tshim par gyur to //
translated: However, through the kindness of the Tathāgata’s compassionate instructions, we have attained diligence in the true path and are satisfied with the benefit and happiness of body and mind.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin sgom zhing thob nas mya ngan las 'das pa la ma sleb kyi bar du ji ltar na shes rab rkyang ba'i sa dang / sems bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi zhes bya ba lags /🔽rim pa gang du sleb pa na sgom pa'i spyan thob pa lags /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin sgom zhing thob nas mya ngan las 'das pa la ma sleb kyi bar du ji ltar na shes rab rkyang ba'i sa dang / sems bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi zhes bya ba lags / rim pa gang du sleb pa na sgom pa'i spyan thob pa lags /
translated: how is it that, having cultivated and attained such a buddha samādhi, until reaching nirvāṇa, there are the stages of the path of mere wisdom and the forty-four minds?🔽At what stage is the attainment of the eye of meditation?

original: gnas gang du sleb pa nas la gnas pa lags /
analyzed: gnas gang du sleb pa nas la gnas pa lags /
translated: At what stage is the attainment of abiding in the bhūmis?

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rgyun mtha' ba zhes bya bar gyur pa bstan du gsol zhes gsol nas yan lag lngas la gtugs te 'khor 'dus pa thams cad sems rtse gcig pas bcom ldan 'das la mig gis blta bzhin du brtse ba'i bka' nod cing 'dug
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rgyun mtha' ba zhes bya bar gyur pa bstan du gsol zhes gsol nas yan lag lngas la gtugs te 'khor 'dus pa thams cad sems rtse gcig pas bcom ldan 'das la mig gis blta bzhin du brtse ba'i bka' nod cing 'dug
translated: He said, Please explain how the bodhisattvas become those who are at the end of the continuum. Having said that, he touched his head to the ground and, while the entire assembly of retinues sat with one-pointed minds, looking at the Bhagavān with their eyes, they waited for his loving words.

original: go / de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la legs so //
analyzed: go / de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la legs so //
translated: At that time, the Bhagavān said to Ānanda, “Excellent!

original: zhes bka' stsal @525a *//
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal @525a *//
translated: Thus he said.🔽🔽

original: nas legs so legs so //
analyzed: nas legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent!

original: khyed cag 'khor 'dus pa'i dge 'dun rnams dang / yang snyigs ma'i dus kyi skye bo dag ting nge 'dzin la sbyong ba dang theg pa chen po tshol ba la so so skye bo'i sa nas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar bla na med pa yang dag par sgom pa'i lam rgya cher bstan pa'i slad🔽du gsol bar spobs so //
analyzed: khyed cag 'khor 'dus pa'i dge 'dun rnams dang / yang snyigs ma'i dus kyi skye bo dag ting nge 'dzin la sbyong ba dang theg pa chen po tshol ba la so so skye bo'i sa nas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar bla na med pa yang dag par sgom pa'i lam rgya cher bstan pa'i slad du gsol bar spobs so //
translated: You and the assembly of retinues, and the beings of the degenerate age who are training in samādhi and seeking the Mahāyāna, from the stage of ordinary beings up to great nirvāṇa, have the confidence to request me to extensively teach the path of perfect meditation.

original: khyed cag legs par nyon dang ngas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: khyed cag legs par nyon dang ngas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen well and I shall explain it to you.

original: zhes bka' stsal pa la /
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal pa la /
translated: Thus did he speak.

original: kun dga' bo la sogs 'khor 'dus pa thams cad thal mo sbyar zhing sems dang bas cang mi smra bar rjes su bstan pa nod cing 'dug go /
analyzed: kun dga' bo la sogs 'khor 'dus pa thams cad thal mo sbyar zhing sems dang bas cang mi smra bar rjes su bstan pa nod cing 'dug go /
translated: Ānanda and the entire assembly of disciples, with palms joined, listened with pure minds to the teachings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda!

original: khyed cag shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed cag shes par gyis shig /
translated: You should understand this:

original: rmad du byung ba'i gsal rig gi rang bzhin de ming dang rnam pa dang bral zhing gdod ma nas 'jig rten dang sems can med do //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i gsal rig gi rang bzhin de ming dang rnam pa dang bral zhing gdod ma nas 'jig rten dang sems can med do //
translated: The wondrous nature of clear awareness is free from names and forms, and from the beginning there are no worlds or sentient beings.

original: rdzun pa'i rkyen gyis skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rdzun pa'i rkyen gyis skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: It arises due to false conditions,

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis 'gag par 'gyur bas skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis rdzun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis 'gag par 'gyur bas skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis rdzun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because it ceases due to the condition of arising, both arising and ceasing are called false.

original: rdzun pa bkag pa ni /
analyzed: rdzun pa bkag pa ni /
translated: The cessation of falsity

original: bden pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya la /
translated: is called truth.

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gnyis kyi ming can no //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gnyis kyi ming can no //
translated: This is the name of the unsurpassed enlightenment of the Tathāgatas and the great nirvāṇa.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda!

original: khyed cag nges par ting nge 'dzin sgom zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen por myur du sleb @525b par 'dod na thog mar sems can dang 'jig rten phyin ci log gnyis kyi rgyu shes par bya rigs so //
analyzed: khyed cag nges par ting nge 'dzin sgom zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen por myur du sleb @525b par 'dod na thog mar sems can dang 'jig rten phyin ci log gnyis kyi rgyu shes par bya rigs so //
translated: If you wish to quickly enter the samādhi of the Tathāgata’s great nirvāṇa, you must first understand the causes of sentient beings and the two errors of the world.

original: phyin ci log med na 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log med na 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa'o //
translated: If there were no errors, this would be the Tathāgata’s true samādhi.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: ci'i phyir sems can phyin ci log ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can phyin ci log ce na /
translated: why are sentient beings in error?

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni //
translated: the nature

original: gsal rig gi sems yin la /
analyzed: gsal rig gi sems yin la /
translated: is the mind of clear awareness.

original: rang bzhin de gsal rig yin pa'i phyir gsal ba las rang bzhin 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin de gsal rig yin pa'i phyir gsal ba las rang bzhin 'byung ngo //
translated: Because that nature is clear awareness, the nature arises from clarity.

original: rang bzhin rdzun pa'i mthong ba skyes pas de gzhi med pa las phyir zhing yod la 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin rdzun pa'i mthong ba skyes pas de gzhi med pa las phyir zhing yod la 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The false seeing of the nature arises from the groundless, and thus existence is established.

original: yod pa dang gang yod pa 'di gnyis kyi bar du rgyu dang gang gi rgyu ma yin zhing gnas pa dang gang du gnas pa'i rnam pa mthar thug na gzhi med pas gdod ma nas gnas pa med pa las 'jig rten dang sems can 'grub bo //
analyzed: yod pa dang gang yod pa 'di gnyis kyi bar du rgyu dang gang gi rgyu ma yin zhing gnas pa dang gang du gnas pa'i rnam pa mthar thug na gzhi med pas gdod ma nas gnas pa med pa las 'jig rten dang sems can 'grub bo //
translated: The relation between existence and what exists, and between location and what is located, is ultimately groundless, and so the world and sentient beings are established from the beginningless absence of location.

original: thog ma'i gsal rig 'grib nas rdzun pa byung ngo //
analyzed: thog ma'i gsal rig 'grib nas rdzun pa byung ngo //
translated: The initial clear awareness fades, and falsity arises.

original: rdzun pa'i rang bzhin la dngos po med pas rten du gzung du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rdzun pa'i rang bzhin la dngos po med pas rten du gzung du mi rung ngo //
translated: Since falsity by nature is insubstantial, it is not suitable to be apprehended as a support.

original: 'di las bden pa tshol na de nyid kyis na bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las bden pa tshol na de nyid kyis na bden pa ma yin no //
translated: If you seek truth from this, it is not true by that very fact.

original: bden pa ma yin pa las tshol na rnam pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin pa las tshol na rnam pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you seek from what is not true, it becomes a false aspect.

original: de dag skye ba ma yin gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: de dag skye ba ma yin gnas pa ma yin /
translated: They are not arising, not abiding,

original: yid ma yin /
analyzed: yid ma yin /
translated: not the mind,

original: chos ma yin pas rim gyis 'khor nas skye'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pas rim gyis 'khor nas skye'o //
translated: not phenomena. They gradually revolve and arise.

original: skye ba'i mthus gsal bar gyur nas bag chags kyi dbang gis las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba'i mthus gsal bar gyur nas bag chags kyi dbang gis las 'byung ngo //
translated: Through the power of arising, they become clear, and through the power of traces, karma arises.

original: las ni / 'dra bar gyur na phan tshun bskul zhing de nas rjes mthun bskul @526a *//
analyzed: las ni / 'dra bar gyur na phan tshun bskul zhing de nas rjes mthun bskul @526a *//
translated: The function is that when they are similar, they mutually encourage each other, and then they encourage the concordant.🔽

original: pa'i las yod pa'i dbang gis phan tshun du 'gag bzhin phan tshun du skye bzhin pa de lta bus sems can phyin ci log tu gyur to //
analyzed: pa'i las yod pa'i dbang gis phan tshun du 'gag bzhin phan tshun du skye bzhin pa de lta bus sems can phyin ci log tu gyur to //
translated: As for its function, when they are similar, they mutually stimulate each other. Then, by the power of the function of mutual stimulation, they mutually cease and mutually arise. In this way, sentient beings become deluded.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: ji ltar 'jig rten phyin ci log ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten phyin ci log ce na /
translated: how are worldly beings deluded?

original: gang gis yod pa 'di dang / gang yod pa de cha so so nas rdzun par skyes pa'i phyir 'di las 'jig rten du gyur to //
analyzed: gang gis yod pa 'di dang / gang yod pa de cha so so nas rdzun par skyes pa'i phyir 'di las 'jig rten du gyur to //
translated: Because of the arising of this false discrimination, the world comes into being.

original: skyed byed dang bskyed bya ma yin; gnas byed dang gnas bya ma yin /
analyzed: skyed byed dang bskyed bya ma yin; gnas byed dang gnas bya ma yin /
translated: It is not a creator and something created, nor is it a support and something supported.

original: de las rim par 'pho bzhin du mi gnas pas 'di las 'grub bo //
analyzed: de las rim par 'pho bzhin du mi gnas pas 'di las 'grub bo //
translated: Because it does not abide, it comes into being.

original: dus gsum dang phyogs bzhi 'phrad cing ltos pa ni /
analyzed: dus gsum dang phyogs bzhi 'phrad cing ltos pa ni /
translated: The three times and the four directions meet and rely on each other.

original: phan tshun du zhugs pas sems can rnams 'gyur zhing skyes nas ris rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'grub bo //
analyzed: phan tshun du zhugs pas sems can rnams 'gyur zhing skyes nas ris rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'grub bo //
translated: Because they mutually enter, sentient beings transform and are born, and the twelve links of dependent arising come into being.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten la g-yo ba'i rkyen gyis sgra byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten la g-yo ba'i rkyen gyis sgra byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, sound arises from the condition of movement in the world.

original: sgra'i rkyen gyis gzugs byung ngo //
analyzed: sgra'i rkyen gyis gzugs byung ngo //
translated: Form arises from the condition of sound.

original: gzugs kyi rkyen gyis dri byung ngo //🔽dri'i rkyen gyis reg bya byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rkyen gyis dri byung ngo // dri'i rkyen gyis reg bya byung ngo //
translated: Smell arises from the condition of form.🔽Touch arises from the condition of smell.

original: reg bya'i rkyen gyis ro byung ngo //
analyzed: reg bya'i rkyen gyis ro byung ngo //
translated: Taste arises from the condition of touch.

original: ro'i rkyen gyis chos shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro'i rkyen gyis chos shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Dharma is known from the condition of taste.

original: 'khrul pa drug po 'di rdzun pa'i sems kyis las kyi rang bzhin 'grub pa'i phyir ris bcu gnyis su gyur nas de las 'khor bar 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa drug po 'di rdzun pa'i sems kyis las kyi rang bzhin 'grub pa'i phyir ris bcu gnyis su gyur nas de las 'khor bar 'khor ro //
translated: Because these six confusions are established by the nature of karma with a false mind, they become the twelve realms, and from that one revolves in samsara.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sgra dri ro reg bya la sogs pa rigs bcu gnyis su gyur nas lan gcig 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sgra dri ro reg bya la sogs pa rigs bcu gnyis su gyur nas lan gcig 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the world's sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and so on become the twelve types, and it is said, Revolve once.

original: 'di ltar 'khor ba phyin ci log gi mtshan ma la brten pas 'jig rten na sgo nga las skye pa dang / mngal las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba dang @526b gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor ba phyin ci log gi mtshan ma la brten pas 'jig rten na sgo nga las skye pa dang / mngal las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba dang @526b gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang /
translated: In this way, based on the signs of error in saṃsāra, in the world there are those born from eggs, those born from wombs, those born from heat and moisture, and those born miraculously, those with form and those without form,

original: 'du shes dang / 'du shes med dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / gzugs med ma yin pa dang / 'du shes can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes med pa ma yin pa de dag so sor phye'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du shes med dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / gzugs med ma yin pa dang / 'du shes can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes med pa ma yin pa de dag so sor phye'o //
translated: those with perception, those without perception, those neither with nor without perception, and those with various distinctions.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'jig rten gyi rdzun zhing mi bden pas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du g-yo ba'i byin ci log gis rkyen la 'phrad cing ltos nas dbugs kyi dbang gis 'phur ba dang bying ba brgyad khri bzhi stong 'khrul pa'i 'du shes 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rdzun zhing mi bden pas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du g-yo ba'i byin ci log gis rkyen la 'phrad cing ltos nas dbugs kyi dbang gis 'phur ba dang bying ba brgyad khri bzhi stong 'khrul pa'i 'du shes 'grub bo //
translated: because of the falsity and unreality of the world, while revolving in saṃsāra, through the power of the eighty-four thousand movements of the breath, the mistaken notion of the eight-four thousand delusions is established.

original: de'i phyir sgo nga'i nur nur po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas nya dang / 'dab chags dang / rus sbal dang / sprul la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgo nga'i nur nur po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas nya dang / 'dab chags dang / rus sbal dang / sprul la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
translated: Having been born in the course of wandering through the country, it is filled and occupied by the species of humans, animals, nāgas, and sages.

original: 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs pas bgos nas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du rtog pa phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos nas 'dres pas 'greng ba dud pa brgyad khri bzhi stong 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //🔽de'i phyir mngal gyi mer mer po yod cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs pas bgos nas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du rtog pa phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos nas 'dres pas 'greng ba dud pa brgyad khri bzhi stong 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo // de'i phyir mngal gyi mer mer po yod cing /
translated: The mind of delusion is established from the eighty-four thousand conceptual thoughts that arise from the condition of the inverted concepts while wandering in saṃsāra, having been born in the course of wandering through the country, having been mixed by the condition of meeting through the inverted concepts while wandering in saṃsāra.

original: yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas mi dang / dud 'gro dang / klu dang / drang srong gi rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas mi dang / dud 'gro dang / klu dang / drang srong gi rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, the embryo of the egg exists, and having been born in the course of wandering through the country, it is filled and occupied by the species of humans, animals, nāgas, and sages.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'dzin zhing 'brel bas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du 'gro ba phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa'i drod las skyes pa brgyad khri bzhi stong 'pho zhing 'gyur ba'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'dzin zhing 'brel bas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du 'gro ba phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa'i drod las skyes pa brgyad khri bzhi stong 'pho zhing 'gyur ba'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
translated: Due to the connection with the world’s clinging, while circling in saṃsāra, the mind of delusion that is the transformation of the eighty-four thousand [beings] is established through the condition of the error of meeting and relying on heat.

original: de'i phyir nar nar po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor @527a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir nar nar po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor @527a *//
translated: Therefore, the oval [stage] exists, and having circled through the regions,

original: zhing skyes nas rig pa med pa'i khum pa dang nur pa'i srin bu'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: zhing skyes nas rig pa med pa'i khum pa dang nur pa'i srin bu'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
translated: after birth, it is filled with the species of worms that are without awareness, such as the wriggling and the rolling.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'pho zhing 'gyur bas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du bcos ma'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa'i reg pas brgyad khri bzhi stong 'khrul pa'i sems gsar rnying 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'pho zhing 'gyur bas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du bcos ma'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa'i reg pas brgyad khri bzhi stong 'khrul pa'i sems gsar rnying 'grub bo //
translated: Due to the transformation of the world’s circling in saṃsāra, the mind of delusion of the new and old eighty-four thousand [beings] is established through the condition of the error of meeting and relying on the contact of fabrication.

original: de'i phyir rdzus skyes kyi gzugs gor gor po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas lus brje ba dang 'phur ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to; ;'jig rten gyi khams su lus shing thogs pas 'khor bar
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzus skyes kyi gzugs gor gor po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas lus brje ba dang 'phur ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to; ;'jig rten gyi khams su lus shing thogs pas 'khor bar
translated: Therefore, the form of the miraculous birth is round, and the world is filled with those who are born in succession in the country, change bodies, fly, walk, and so on.

original: 'khor bzhin du sgrib pa phyin ci log gi rkyen gyi sa 'phrad cing ltos pa'i 'dzin pas brgyad khri bzhi stong gsal zhing 'tsher ba'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'khor bzhin du sgrib pa phyin ci log gi rkyen gyi sa 'phrad cing ltos pa'i 'dzin pas brgyad khri bzhi stong gsal zhing 'tsher ba'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
translated: While wandering in the world, obstructed and impeded, the mind of delusion, which is clear and bright, is established by the clinging that meets and depends on the condition of the obscuration of error.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa'i gzugs can gor gor po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas mtshan ma bzang po dang ltas ngan pa shes pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa'i gzugs can gor gor po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas mtshan ma bzang po dang ltas ngan pa shes pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, the form of the aspect is round, and the world is filled with those who are born in succession in the country and know good and bad omens.

original: 'jig rten gyi zhi ba dang 'thor bas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du rtog pa phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pas mi mngon pa'i gzugs phra mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gi 'khrul ba'i sems 'grub bo //

translated: As the world revolves in its cycles of peace and chaos, the eight-four thousand subtle forms of delusion are established by the conditions of the mistaken thoughts that meet and rely on each other.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa'i gor gor po yod cing yul khams su brgyud da de 'khor bar skyes nas stong ba dang @527b 'thor ba dang zhi ba dang byir ba la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //

translated: Therefore, the formless globules exist, and the world is filled with the various types of beings who are born in cyclic existence, such as the empty, the scattered, the peaceful, and the coarse.

original: 'jig rten gyi gzugs srab mos 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du grib ma'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltes pa'i 'dod pas brgyad khri bzhi stong gi mi mngon par 'ching ba'i 'khrul ba'i sems 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gzugs srab mos 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du grib ma'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltes pa'i 'dod pas brgyad khri bzhi stong gi mi mngon par 'ching ba'i 'khrul ba'i sems 'grub bo //
translated: As the world revolves in its cycles of peace and chaos, the eight-four thousand subtle forms of delusion are established by the conditions of the mistaken thoughts that meet and rely on each other.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes kyi rnam pa'i gor gor po yod cing brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas lha 'dre bdud dang gdon la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //

translated: Therefore, there is a sphere of perception, and having been born in a place filled with gods, demons, devils, and spirits, it revolves through the regions.

original: 'jig rten gyi rmongs shing blun pas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du rmongs pa phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa sems med kyis brgyad khri bzhi stong rtsva skam lta bu'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rmongs shing blun pas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du rmongs pa phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa sems med kyis brgyad khri bzhi stong rtsva skam lta bu'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
translated: Since the world is deluded and foolish, it revolves in cyclic existence. Due to the condition of deluded error, the mind-as-such, which is without mind, meets with and depends on the eighty-four thousand [afflictions], and the deluded mind, like dry grass, is produced.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i gor gor po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas dvangs ma 'gyur nas sa shing lcags rdo la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gang bar gyur to //

translated: Therefore, there is a sphere of nonperception, and having been born in a place filled with the types of earth, trees, iron, stone, and so on, it revolves through the regions.

original: 'jig rten gyi phan tshun 'grogs pas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du bcos ma'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa'i bgobs brgyad khri bzhi stong gi brten pa dang yid ches pa'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi phan tshun 'grogs pas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du bcos ma'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa'i bgobs brgyad khri bzhi stong gi brten pa dang yid ches pa'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, in the world, as one associates with others, one circles in saṃsāra. Due to the conditions of the fabricated errors, the eighty-four thousand kinds of clothing that are worn and trusted are established as the deluded mind.

original: de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs can ma yin pa gzugs su gyur pa'i gor gor po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas chu'i ma zhes bya ba'i srin bu la lcang mos mig byas pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to🔽// 'jig rten gyi gcig gis gcig @528a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs can ma yin pa gzugs su gyur pa'i gor gor po yod cing yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas chu'i ma zhes bya ba'i srin bu la lcang mos mig byas pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to // 'jig rten gyi gcig gis gcig @528a *//
translated: Therefore, the form and formless become the form of the kalala, and having been born in the country, it is filled with the type of worms called “water mother” that have eyes on their anthers.

original: drangs nas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du rang bzhin phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa'i dmod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi 'bod pa dang bsgrags pa'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
analyzed: drangs nas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du rang bzhin phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa'i dmod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi 'bod pa dang bsgrags pa'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
translated: In the world, as one is drawn by another, one circles in saṃsāra. Due to the conditions of the natural errors, the eighty-four thousand kinds of curses that are called out and proclaimed are established as the deluded mind.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med ma yin zhing gzugs med pa'i gor gor po yod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med ma yin zhing gzugs med pa'i gor gor po yod cing /
translated: Therefore, there is a formless non-form, and there is a formless sphere.

original: yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas mnan pa dang byad dang dmod pa bor ba la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas mnan pa dang byad dang dmod pa bor ba la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
translated: It is filled with and occupied by the kinds of beings who wander through the regions, are born, and are oppressed by curses, spells, and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi rdzun gyis 'brel ba'i 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du 'khrul pa'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa las gzhan brgyad khri bzhi stong phan tshun 'khrug pa'i sems 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rdzun gyis 'brel ba'i 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du 'khrul pa'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa las gzhan brgyad khri bzhi stong phan tshun 'khrug pa'i sems 'grub bo //
translated: While wandering in cyclic existence through the worldly connection of lies, the other 84,000 kinds of minds that are established from the conditions of the error of confusion and from meeting and relying on each other are established.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes can gzugs can ma yin zhing 'du shes can sgrub pa'i gor gor po yod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes can gzugs can ma yin zhing 'du shes can sgrub pa'i gor gor po yod cing /

original: yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas bung ba dang dar gyi srin bu ltar gzhan gyi lus kyis rang rigs 'grub par byed pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: yul khams su brgyud de 'khor zhing skyes nas bung ba dang dar gyi srin bu ltar gzhan gyi lus kyis rang rigs 'grub par byed pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
translated: It is filled with and occupied by the kinds of beings who wander through the regions, are born, and establish their own kind in the bodies of others, like bees and silkworms, and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'khon dang gnod pas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du gsod pa'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa ya mtshan can brgyad khri bzhi stong gi pha ma za ba'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'khon dang gnod pas 'khor bar 'khor bzhin du gsod pa'i phyin ci log gi rkyen gyis 'phrad cing ltos pa ya mtshan can brgyad khri bzhi stong gi pha ma za ba'i 'khrul pa'i sems 'grub bo //
translated: In the world, while revolving in cyclic existence due to enmity and harm, the mind of delusion that eats one’s parents through the amazing condition of meeting and relying on the eighty-four thousand kinds of killing arises.

original: de'i phyir 'du shes med pa ma yin pa'i gzugs dang 'du shes med pa'i gor gor po yod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes med pa ma yin pa'i gzugs dang 'du shes med pa'i gor gor po yod cing /
translated: Therefore, there is form that is not non-perception and there is the kalala that is non-perception.

original: yul khams su brgyud de 'khor @528b zhing skyes nas srin bya la sogs pa ltar sa'i gong bu las phrug gu byed pa dang bya sdig can du gshing gi 'bras bu las phrug gu byed pa ltar phrug gu grub nas pha ma za bar byed pa la sogs

translated: Having been born and circulated through the country, like a crow, they make eggs from a lump of earth and like a bird of ill omen, they make eggs from the fruit of a tree. Having established the eggs, they eat their parents and so on.

original: ba'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: ba'i rigs kyis gtams shing gang bar gyur to //

analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na 'jig rten na phan tshun skye ba dang gsod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you are endowed with moral discipline, then in the world there will be no mutual killing and the results of actions.

original: brku ba dang 'phrog pa ma byas na phan tshun du bu lon med pa'i phyir skye ba sngon ma'i lan chags pa bsab mi dgos so //
analyzed: brku ba dang 'phrog pa ma byas na phan tshun du bu lon med pa'i phyir skye ba sngon ma'i lan chags pa bsab mi dgos so //
translated: If you do not steal or rob, then you will not have to repay debts from previous lives because you will not owe each other anything.

original: 'di lta bu'i rnam par dag pa'i skye bo ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la sbyangs pas pha ma las skyes pa'i lus dang lha'i mig la mi ltos par rang nyid kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag mthong nas de bzhin gshegs pa dang mjal nas chos thos
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rnam par dag pa'i skye bo ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la sbyangs pas pha ma las skyes pa'i lus dang lha'i mig la mi ltos par rang nyid kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag mthong nas de bzhin gshegs pa dang mjal nas chos thos
translated: Such a pure being, through training in the cultivation of concentration, without relying on a body born from parents or the divine eye, sees the worlds of the ten directions with their own eyes, meets the Tathagatas, hears the Dharma,

original: te bka' lung nod cing rdzu 'phrul chen po thob ste phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su thogs med du bgrod nas sngon gyi gnas gsal bar dran zhing sdug bsngal drag po las thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te bka' lung nod cing rdzu 'phrul chen po thob ste phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su thogs med du bgrod nas sngon gyi gnas gsal bar dran zhing sdug bsngal drag po las thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: receives the teachings, attains great miracles, travels unobstructedly to the worlds of the ten directions, clearly remembers past lives, and is liberated from intense suffering.

original: 'di la rim gyis gong du spel zhing brtson par byed pa'i rim pa gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la rim gyis gong du spel zhing brtson par byed pa'i rim pa gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the second stage of gradual increase and effort.

original: ci zhig mngon gyur yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig mngon gyur yin zhe na /
translated: What is manifest?

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: 'di lta bu'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par srung ba'i skye bo sems la zhen pa'i 'dod chags med pa'i phyir phyi'i yul drug gi rjes su snyegs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par srung ba'i skye bo sems la zhen pa'i 'dod chags med pa'i phyir phyi'i yul drug gi rjes su snyegs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the person who thus observes pure morality is free from the attachment of mental clinging, he does not pursue the six external objects.

original: snyegs par mi 'gyur bas nang du rang gi gdod ma'i tshul la gzhol par @530b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snyegs par mi 'gyur bas nang du rang gi gdod ma'i tshul la gzhol par @530b 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not pursue them, he turns inward to his original nature.

original: yul dang mi 'brel na dbang po grogs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang mi 'brel na dbang po grogs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is not related to objects, the sense organs do not become his companions.

original: yul la snyegs pa las logs nas gcig tu gyur ba na longs spyod drug 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dag par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul la snyegs pa las logs nas gcig tu gyur ba na longs spyod drug 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dag par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is apart from pursuing objects, the six enjoyments do not arise, and he sees the pure worlds of the ten directions.

original: dper na / bee d'rya'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan shar ba ltar lus sems shin tu bde zhing gsal rig mnyam pa nyid thob nas bde ba chen po brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / bee d'rya'i nang du zla ba'i gzugs brnyan shar ba ltar lus sems shin tu bde zhing gsal rig mnyam pa nyid thob nas bde ba chen po brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, just as the reflection of the moon appears in vaidurya, his body and mind become extremely blissful, and he attains the equality of clear awareness, and great bliss becomes stable.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zab cing rnam par dag pa'i gsal rig rmad du byung ba yongs su rdzogs pa de'i nang du gsal bar gyur nas skye bo 'di mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zab cing rnam par dag pa'i gsal rig rmad du byung ba yongs su rdzogs pa de'i nang du gsal bar gyur nas skye bo 'di mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, within the perfect, wondrous, clear, and pure awareness of all the Tathāgatas, this person will attain the acceptance that phenomena are not produced.

original: 'di nas rim gyis sbyangs te mngon du gyur pa'i spyod pa dam pa'i gral du bde blag tu chud pa'i phyir 'di la gong du spel zhing brtson par byed pa'i rim pa gsum pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nas rim gyis sbyangs te mngon du gyur pa'i spyod pa dam pa'i gral du bde blag tu chud pa'i phyir 'di la gong du spel zhing brtson par byed pa'i rim pa gsum pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the third stage of the process of refinement, in which one applies oneself with diligence to further enhancement, in order to gradually refine away the remaining propensities and to easily enter the ranks of those who engage in the conduct of manifest enlightenment.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu 'dod chags rab tu bsal te dbang po yul dang mi 'brel ba'i phyir da lta'i lus 'di nyid las slar skye ba len par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu 'dod chags rab tu bsal te dbang po yul dang mi 'brel ba'i phyir da lta'i lus 'di nyid las slar skye ba len par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: sons or daughters of good family who have completely eliminated desire, because their faculties are no longer connected to objects, will not take rebirth again in this very body.

original: de nas gsal stong gi sems brtan pa las shes rab 'ba' zhig tu gyur to //
analyzed: de nas gsal stong gi sems brtan pa las shes rab 'ba' zhig tu gyur to //
translated: Then, from the stabilization of the mind of clarity and emptiness, wisdom alone will arise.

original: blo'i rang bzhin rnam par dag cing gsal bar gyur te phyogs bcu'i khams su khyab cing shes rab 'ba' zhig tu gyur pa la shes rab rkyang pa zhes bya'o //🔽'di ni / 'dod chags kyi bag chags bsal na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i rgyun dang @531a *//
analyzed: blo'i rang bzhin rnam par dag cing gsal bar gyur te phyogs bcu'i khams su khyab cing shes rab 'ba' zhig tu gyur pa la shes rab rkyang pa zhes bya'o // 'di ni / 'dod chags kyi bag chags bsal na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i rgyun dang @531a *//
translated: The nature of the mind becomes pure and clear, pervading the realms in the ten directions, and becomes only wisdom. This is called “only wisdom.”

original: da dung ma 'phrad do //
analyzed: da dung ma 'phrad do //
translated: Even though the habitual tendencies of desire are removed, one still has not encountered the stream of the nectar of the Dharma of the Tathāgatas.

original: de ltar sems 'di bzung nas dbu ma'i lam du gzhol ba'i sgo nas drang por sbyangs na rmad du byung ba'i ye shes gong nas gong du 'phel zhing mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sems 'di bzung nas dbu ma'i lam du gzhol ba'i sgo nas drang por sbyangs na rmad du byung ba'i ye shes gong nas gong du 'phel zhing mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is thus grasped and trained in being straight by being directed to the middle way, marvelous wisdom increases more and more and becomes manifest.

original: rmad du byung ba'i bden pa yun du gnas pas rnam rtog ngan pa'i sems sna tshogs pa thams cad zad nas dbu ma'i lam bden pa 'ba' zhig par gyur to //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i bden pa yun du gnas pas rnam rtog ngan pa'i sems sna tshogs pa thams cad zad nas dbu ma'i lam bden pa 'ba' zhig par gyur to //
translated: Since the marvelous truth remains for a long time, all the various kinds of bad thoughts are exhausted and the middle way becomes the only truth.

original: 'di la yang dag par dad pa'i sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang dag par dad pa'i sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the mind that is correctly faithful.”

original: bden pa'i tshul yang dag par mthong nas mngon par byang chub pa thob pa'i phyir phung po dang khams dang skye mched gsum thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshul yang dag par mthong nas mngon par byang chub pa thob pa'i phyir phung po dang khams dang skye mched gsum thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen the mode of reality correctly, one attains manifest enlightenment, and so the three—the aggregates, the elements, and the sense-fields—become unobstructed.

original: de nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa grangs med pa'i 'jig rten du lus 'dor ba dang lus blangs pa'i bag chags rnying pa sna tshogs pa thams cad mig sngar mngon sum du mthong bas 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu dag thams cad du dran zhing
analyzed: de nas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa grangs med pa'i 'jig rten du lus 'dor ba dang lus blangs pa'i bag chags rnying pa sna tshogs pa thams cad mig sngar mngon sum du mthong bas 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu dag thams cad du dran zhing
translated: Then, all the various old habitual tendencies of casting off the body and taking up the body in the world of incalculable past and future eons are seen directly in the present, and so all the sons of the family are mindful of this and

original: mi brjed pa dang mi g-yel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi brjed pa dang mi g-yel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: are not forgetful or distracted.

original: 'di la dran pa sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la dran pa sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “mindfulness abiding in the mind.”

original: rmad du byung ba'i ye shes mchog tu bden pa thob ste bden pa'i rang gdangs kyi rdzu 'phrul thob nas thog ma med pa'i bag chags rnying pa thams cad gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i ye shes mchog tu bden pa thob ste bden pa'i rang gdangs kyi rdzu 'phrul thob nas thog ma med pa'i bag chags rnying pa thams cad gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel lo //
translated: Having attained the supreme truth of wondrous wisdom, having attained the magical power of the natural radiance of truth, one is connected with the nature of clarity of all the old habitual tendencies from beginningless time.

original: 'di la gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis bden pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas sgom pa la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis bden pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas sgom pa la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi sems zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mind of diligence in application to meditation through the pure truth of the nature of clarity.

original: sems kyi @531b rang bzhin rnam par dag pa mngon du gyur nas ye shes thob pa ni shes rab sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi @531b rang bzhin rnam par dag pa mngon du gyur nas ye shes thob pa ni shes rab sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the pure nature of the mind becomes manifest and one attains wisdom, this is called the mind of wisdom abiding in the mind.

original: shes rab gsal ba bzung nas g-yo ba med cing rnam par dag pa khyab par gyur nas rmad du byung ba'i mi g-yo ba rtag par gnas pa la ting nge 'dzin sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab gsal ba bzung nas g-yo ba med cing rnam par dag pa khyab par gyur nas rmad du byung ba'i mi g-yo ba rtag par gnas pa la ting nge 'dzin sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one grasps the clarity of wisdom, becomes unshakable, and pervades with purity, abiding in the marvelous, unshakable, and constant state, this is called the mind of samādhi abiding in the mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'od zer gsal bar 'phros shing gsal ba'i rang bzhin zab mor gyur te 'phel ba las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'od zer gsal bar 'phros shing gsal ba'i rang bzhin zab mor gyur te 'phel ba las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The light rays of samādhi shine brightly, and the nature of clarity becomes profound and increases without turning back.

original: 'di la phyir mi ldog pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la phyir mi ldog pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mind of irreversibility.

original: sems lhag par bde bas gnas te skyong zhing bsrungs nas mi 'chor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems lhag par bde bas gnas te skyong zhing bsrungs nas mi 'chor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding in the mind of supreme bliss, one protects and guards it without distraction.

original: de nas phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin nus pa dang mthun pa la chos skyong ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin nus pa dang mthun pa la chos skyong ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, the nature of the tathāgatas of the ten directions, in accordance with their power and ability, is called the mind of Dharma protection.

original: gsal rig gis bskyangs shing rmad du byung ba'i nus pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i 'od zer lus la phog ste sangs rgyas la phyogs te gnas shing me long gnyis kyi 'od phan tshun du phog ste de'i nang du gzugs brnyan rim pa mang po 'char ba
analyzed: gsal rig gis bskyangs shing rmad du byung ba'i nus pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje'i 'od zer lus la phog ste sangs rgyas la phyogs te gnas shing me long gnyis kyi 'od phan tshun du phog ste de'i nang du gzugs brnyan rim pa mang po 'char ba
translated: Sustained by clear awareness, with wondrous power, the light rays of the tathāgatas' compassion strike the body, and one abides facing the buddhas. Like the light of two mirrors striking each other, many layers of reflections arise within them.

original: dang 'dra'o // 'di la lus la phog nas sangs rgyas la phyogs pa'i sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang 'dra'o // 'di la lus la phog nas sangs rgyas la phyogs pa'i sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, it is called the abiding of the mind facing the buddhas after being struck by the light.

original: sems la 'od zer mi mngon par phog pas sangs rgyas kyi rtag brtan rmad du byung ba'i rnam par dag pa bla na med pa thob nas 'bad med du bde bar gnas shing nyams pa dang chad pa med pa la tshul khrims kyi sems gnas pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: sems la 'od zer mi mngon par phog pas sangs rgyas kyi rtag brtan rmad du byung ba'i rnam par dag pa bla na med pa thob nas 'bad med du bde bar gnas shing nyams pa dang chad pa med pa la tshul khrims kyi sems gnas pa zhes bya'o
translated: Since the light strikes the mind without being apparent, one attains the buddhas' permanence, stability, wondrous purity, and unsurpassed state. Abiding effortlessly and blissfully, without loss or interruption, it is called the abiding of the mind of discipline.

original: // tshul khrims la gnas shing dbang thob @532a *//
analyzed: // tshul khrims la gnas shing dbang thob @532a *//
translated: Abiding in morality and attaining mastery,

original: nas phyogs bcur khyab par song ste ji ltar 'dod pa'i gnas su phyin pa ni /
analyzed: nas phyogs bcur khyab par song ste ji ltar 'dod pa'i gnas su phyin pa ni /
translated: they pervade the ten directions and go to wherever they wish.

original: smon pa'i sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smon pa'i sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called abiding in the aspiration mind.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu dag nges par thabs la mkhas pas sems rnam pa bcu gnyis 'di dag bskyed nas sems kyi rang bzhin gsal bar phye ma thag tu longs spyod bcu po thams cad gcig gi nang du gcig chud nas sems gcig gis rdzogs par bsgrubs
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu dag nges par thabs la mkhas pas sems rnam pa bcu gnyis 'di dag bskyed nas sems kyi rang bzhin gsal bar phye ma thag tu longs spyod bcu po thams cad gcig gi nang du gcig chud nas sems gcig gis rdzogs par bsgrubs
translated: sons of good family like this, having definitely generated these twelve aspects of mind through skillful means, immediately clarify the nature of mind. All ten enjoyments are contained within one, and one mind accomplishes them.

original: so // 'di la 'phel bskyed kyi sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so // 'di la 'phel bskyed kyi sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called abiding in the mind of increase.

original: sems kyi nang du gsal bar gyur pa ni bee d'urya dvangs pa'i nang du gser btso ma mthong ba ltar snga ma'i rmad du byung ba'i sems phul du gyur te lam gcig gis 'gro ba la sbyangs pa'i sa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi nang du gsal bar gyur pa ni bee d'urya dvangs pa'i nang du gser btso ma mthong ba ltar snga ma'i rmad du byung ba'i sems phul du gyur te lam gcig gis 'gro ba la sbyangs pa'i sa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The clarity within the mind is like seeing refined gold within clear beryl. The former marvelous mind becomes supreme. Traveling by a single path, it is called abiding on the ground of training.

original: sems dngos 'du shes dang rab tu mthun nas thams cad gsal bar rtogs te phyogs bcur khyab par song ba na gtan nas chags thogs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dngos 'du shes dang rab tu mthun nas thams cad gsal bar rtogs te phyogs bcur khyab par song ba na gtan nas chags thogs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is in accord with the discernment of reality, all is clearly understood, and when it pervades the ten directions, it is forever unobstructed.

original: 'di la chos sbyangs pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o;/
analyzed: 'di la chos sbyangs pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o;/
translated: This is called “abiding in the training in the Dharma.”

original: sbyangs pas sangs rgyas dang mnyam par gyur te sangs rgyas kyi nus pa thob nas bar do'i lus kyis pha ma btsal ba ltar bar ma do'i shes pa mi mngon par rdzogs shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyangs pas sangs rgyas dang mnyam par gyur te sangs rgyas kyi nus pa thob nas bar do'i lus kyis pha ma btsal ba ltar bar ma do'i shes pa mi mngon par rdzogs shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Through training, one becomes equal to the buddhas, attains the power of the buddhas, and seeks out parents with the body of the intermediate state. The consciousness of the intermediate state becomes invisible, and one becomes a member of the family of the tathāgatas.

original: 'di la skye ba mchog la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la skye ba mchog la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “abiding in the supreme rebirth.”

original: sangs rgyas lhums su zhugs nas lus tshor ba mthong ba longs spyod cing skye @532b ba'i lus gsal bar gyur nas mi'i lus ma tshang ba med pa bzhin du 'di la thabs mkhas dang ldan pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lhums su zhugs nas lus tshor ba mthong ba longs spyod cing skye @532b ba'i lus gsal bar gyur nas mi'i lus ma tshang ba med pa bzhin du 'di la thabs mkhas dang ldan pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the buddhas enter the womb and see the body and sensations, they enjoy the body of birth and clearly manifest the human body without any deficiency. This is called “abiding in skillful means.”

original: rnam pa dang ngang tshul sangs rgyas dang 'dra zhing sems kyi mtshan ma yang gcig tu gyur pa na 'di la brten pa'i sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang ngang tshul sangs rgyas dang 'dra zhing sems kyi mtshan ma yang gcig tu gyur pa na 'di la brten pa'i sems la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the form and state are like a Buddha and the characteristics of the mind become one, this is called “abiding in the mind that is based on this.”

original: lus sems gcig tu byas nas rim gyis yar ldan du sgrub pa la mi ldog par gnas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus sems gcig tu byas nas rim gyis yar ldan du sgrub pa la mi ldog par gnas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Having made body and mind one, gradually accomplishing without turning back is called “abiding in the mind that is irreversible.”

original: lus kyi mtshan dang dpe byad rnam pa bcu dus gcig tu rdzogs par sgrub pa la gzhon nu la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mtshan dang dpe byad rnam pa bcu dus gcig tu rdzogs par sgrub pa la gzhon nu la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Simultaneously accomplishing the ten aspects of the major and minor marks of the body is called “abiding in youth.”

original: gzugs rdzogs par grub nas mngal nas byung ste sangs rgyas las 'khrungs pa'i sras su gyur pa la chos kyi rgyal po'i sras la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rdzogs par grub nas mngal nas byung ste sangs rgyas las 'khrungs pa'i sras su gyur pa la chos kyi rgyal po'i sras la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having perfected the form, emerging from the womb and becoming the son born from a Buddha is called “abiding as the son of the Dharma King.”

original: cher skyes nas dar la babs pa na rgyal po chen pos rgyal srid kyi bya ba rgyal po'i bu la bsgos nas gtad pa ltar rgyal rigs kyi bu cher skyes nas dar la babs pa na gral bsgrigs nas bu thu bo la spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba🔽dang 'dra ba ni /
analyzed: cher skyes nas dar la babs pa na rgyal po chen pos rgyal srid kyi bya ba rgyal po'i bu la bsgos nas gtad pa ltar rgyal rigs kyi bu cher skyes nas dar la babs pa na gral bsgrigs nas bu thu bo la spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dang 'dra ba ni /
translated: In the same way, when the sons of the great royal family have grown up and become adults, they are placed in the ranks and the eldest son is anointed on the head.

original: dbang bskur ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “abiding in the consecration.”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: rigs kyi bu de rgyal ba'i sras su gyur nas yon tan dam pa dpag tu med pa phun sum tshogs te phyogs bcur rjes su mthun pas 'di la rab tu dga' ba'i sbyod pa zhes bgya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de rgyal ba'i sras su gyur nas yon tan dam pa dpag tu med pa phun sum tshogs te phyogs bcur rjes su mthun pas 'di la rab tu dga' ba'i sbyod pa zhes bgya'o //
translated: when that son of noble family has become a son of the Victorious One, he is endowed with limitless sublime qualities and is perfect in every way. In the ten directions, he is in accord with this, and so it is called the practice of utter joy.

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can thams cad kyi don byed pas 'di la phan pa chen po sgrub pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can thams cad kyi don byed pas 'di la phan pa chen po sgrub pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He benefits all sentient beings through his skillful means, and so it is called the practice of accomplishing great benefit.

original: rang nyid sad pas gzhan sad par byed pa la mi @533a *//
analyzed: rang nyid sad pas gzhan sad par byed pa la mi @533a *//
translated: He awakens others by being awakened himself, and so there is no disagreement.

original: mthun pa med pas 'di la khong khro ba med pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthun pa med pas 'di la khong khro ba med pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the practice of being free from anger.

original: skye rgu sna tshogs pa las 'das nas ma 'ongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi mtha'i bar du srid pa gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pas phyogs bcu kun tu khyab pas 'di la zad pa med pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye rgu sna tshogs pa las 'das nas ma 'ongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi mtha'i bar du srid pa gsum mnyam pa nyid du shes pas phyogs bcu kun tu khyab pas 'di la zad pa med pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having transcended the various kinds of living beings, he knows the three worlds to be the same up to the end of future world-ages. Therefore, because he pervades the ten directions, this is called the inexhaustible practice.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i chos kyi sgo thams cad ro gcig cing 'gal ba dang nor ba med pa'i phyir 'di la rmongs shing 'khrug pa dang bral ba'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i chos kyi sgo thams cad ro gcig cing 'gal ba dang nor ba med pa'i phyir 'di la rmongs shing 'khrug pa dang bral ba'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because all the various Dharma doors are of one taste and are free from contradiction and error, this is called the practice free from confusion and disturbance.

original: 'di la tha mi dad pa las tha dad pa thams cad gsal bar shes shing tha dad pa so so las rang rang gi tha mi dad pa mthong ba'i phyir 'di la mngon du gyur pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la tha mi dad pa las tha dad pa thams cad gsal bar shes shing tha dad pa so so las rang rang gi tha mi dad pa mthong ba'i phyir 'di la mngon du gyur pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he clearly knows all the differences that arise from non-difference and sees the non-difference of each individual difference, this is called the manifest practice.

original: 'di nas phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i khams rdul phra rab kyis gang ba la rdul re re'i nang du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsal bar snang zhing rdul dang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gis gcig mi bsgrib pa'i phyir 'di la thogs pa med pa'i spyod pa zhes
analyzed: 'di nas phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i khams rdul phra rab kyis gang ba la rdul re re'i nang du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsal bar snang zhing rdul dang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gis gcig mi bsgrib pa'i phyir 'di la thogs pa med pa'i spyod pa zhes
translated: Since the realms of the worlds in the ten directions appear clearly within each atom of the atoms that fill the realms of space in the ten directions, and since the atoms and the realms of the worlds do not obscure each other, this is called “the conduct of nonobstruction.”

original: bya'o; ;rnam pa sna tshogs gsal bar snang ba ni /
analyzed: bya'o; ;rnam pa sna tshogs gsal bar snang ba ni /
translated: Since it manifests as various aspects,

original: thog mar pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'di la mchog rab kyi spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'di la mchog rab kyi spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called “the conduct of the supreme.”

original: 'di bzhin du lhun gyis grub nas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshad kyi rnam pa dang mthun pas 'di la chos bzang po'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bzhin du lhun gyis grub nas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshad kyi rnam pa dang mthun pas 'di la chos bzang po'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is spontaneously present in this way, and since it is in accord with the measure of all the buddhas in the ten directions, this is called “the conduct of the good Dharma.”

original: re re nas rnam par dag cing zag pa med pa'i bden pa @533b gcig pu ma bcos pa thams cad gdod ma'i rang bzhin las byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'di la yang dag pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: re re nas rnam par dag cing zag pa med pa'i bden pa @533b gcig pu ma bcos pa thams cad gdod ma'i rang bzhin las byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'di la yang dag pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Each is pure and uncontaminated, the only truth, uncontrived, and arises from the primordial nature. Therefore, this is called the right practice.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu dag rdzu 'phrul yongs su grub cing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrubs nas bden pa rang bzhin rnam par dag pa gsal bar gyur pas sna tshogs pa'i sems kyi rgud pa dang phral nas sems can thams cad bkri zhing sgrol ba la
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu dag rdzu 'phrul yongs su grub cing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrubs nas bden pa rang bzhin rnam par dag pa gsal bar gyur pas sna tshogs pa'i sems kyi rgud pa dang phral nas sems can thams cad bkri zhing sgrol ba la
translated: when sons of noble family like this accomplish their miracles and accomplish the deeds of the buddhas, the pure nature of the truth becomes clear. They separate from the various mental afflictions and guide and liberate all sentient beings.

original: bkri zhing sgrol ba'i rnam pa 'gag nas 'du ma byas pa'i sems phyir log ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la phyogs pas 'di la sems can thams cad srung zhing skyob pa la sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bkri zhing sgrol ba'i rnam pa 'gag nas 'du ma byas pa'i sems phyir log ste mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la phyogs pas 'di la sems can thams cad srung zhing skyob pa la sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the aspect of guiding and liberating ceases, the unconditioned mind turns back and faces the path of nirvāṇa. This is called the dedication that is free from the aspects of all sentient beings, protecting and saving all sentient beings.

original: gzhom par 'os pa bcom pa dang bral ba thams cad dang ring du bral na 'di la gzhom du med pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhom par 'os pa bcom pa dang bral ba thams cad dang ring du bral na 'di la gzhom du med pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is completely free from all that is to be overcome and from that which is not to be overcome, this is called the dedication of the unovercomeable.

original: gdod ma'i rig pa rnam par dag pas rig pa de sangs rgyas kyi rig pa dang 'dra bar gyur pa na 'di la sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdod ma'i rig pa rnam par dag pas rig pa de sangs rgyas kyi rig pa dang 'dra bar gyur pa na 'di la sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one's awareness becomes like the awareness of the Buddha through the primordial purity of awareness, this is called the dedication of equality with all the Buddhas.

original: bden pa'i rang bzhin mngon du gyur cing /
analyzed: bden pa'i rang bzhin mngon du gyur cing /
translated: When the nature of truth is actualized,

original: sa ni / sangs rgyas kyis dang 'dra bar gyur pa na 'di la gnas thams cad khyab pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa ni / sangs rgyas kyis dang 'dra bar gyur pa na 'di la gnas thams cad khyab pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and the ground becomes like the Buddha, this is called the dedication of the pervasion of all abodes.

original: 'jig rten dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad phan tshun du chud pa lo sgrib thogs med par gyur par  zad pa med pa'i yon tan mdzod kyi bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad phan tshun du chud pa lo sgrib thogs med par gyur par  zad pa med pa'i yon tan mdzod kyi bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the world and all the Tathagatas mutually penetrate each other, and there is no longer any obstruction or hindrance, this is called the dedication of the inexhaustible treasury of good qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dang mnyam par gyur pa'i dang nas rang rang gi rnam par dag pa'i rgyu skyes shing rgyu de la brten nas @534a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dang mnyam par gyur pa'i dang nas rang rang gi rnam par dag pa'i rgyu skyes shing rgyu de la brten nas @534a *//
translated: When, having become equal to the stage of the Tathagata, they are born from the cause of their own purity and, based on that cause,

original: 'phel bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam 'grub na 'di la rigs bzang po dang rjes su ma thun pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phel bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam 'grub na 'di la rigs bzang po dang rjes su ma thun pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: they increase and accomplish the path to nirvana, this is called the dedication of the equal nature of the good lineage.

original: yang dag pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sgrubs nas phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad bdag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin yongs su sgrub cing sems can mi gtong bar gyur pa na 'di la sems can thams cad dang rjes su mthun zhing mnyam pa nyid du🔽gzigs pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sgrubs nas phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad bdag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin yongs su sgrub cing sems can mi gtong bar gyur pa na 'di la sems can thams cad dang rjes su mthun zhing mnyam pa nyid du🔽gzigs pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When, having accomplished the roots of virtue, all sentient beings in the ten directions become the nature of oneself, and one does not abandon sentient beings by accomplishing their nature, this is called the dedication of seeing in accordance with and equality with all sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa la thams cad kyi rnam pa dang bral zhing rjes su mthun pa dang bral ba rnam pa gnyis la mi gnas na 'di la yang dag pa'i rnam pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa la thams cad kyi rnam pa dang bral zhing rjes su mthun pa dang bral ba rnam pa gnyis la mi gnas na 'di la yang dag pa'i rnam pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: If one is in accord with all dharmas and yet free from all aspects and free from being in accord, then this is called the dedication of the correct aspects.

original: yang dag pa thob nas phyogs bcu'i sgrib pa med par gyur pa na 'di la bcings pa med cing rnam par grol ba'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa thob nas phyogs bcu'i sgrib pa med par gyur pa na 'di la bcings pa med cing rnam par grol ba'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Having attained the correct, and then being unobstructed in the ten directions, then this is called the dedication of being unbound and liberated.

original: rang bzhin gyi yon tan yongs su rdzogs shing chos kyi khams tshad med par gyur pa na 'di la chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yon tan yongs su rdzogs shing chos kyi khams tshad med par gyur pa na 'di la chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa'i bsngo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the naturally perfected qualities are complete and the dharma realm becomes immeasurable, then this is called the dedication of the immeasurable dharma realm.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi du dag rnam par dag pa'i sems bzhi bcu rtsa gcig rdzogs nas rim gyis mchog tu rgyas pa'i sbyor lam rnam pa bzhi sgrub par rigs so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi du dag rnam par dag pa'i sems bzhi bcu rtsa gcig rdzogs nas rim gyis mchog tu rgyas pa'i sbyor lam rnam pa bzhi sgrub par rigs so //
translated: when the forty-one types of pure mind of this kind are complete, it is appropriate to gradually accomplish the four types of the path of preparation that is supreme and vast.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rig pa rang gi sems kyi ngo bor byas nas mngon du gyur ma gyur gtsub shing gtsubs nas shing bsreg go snyam pa ltar gyur @534b pas 'di la drod byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rig pa rang gi sems kyi ngo bor byas nas mngon du gyur ma gyur gtsub shing gtsubs nas shing bsreg go snyam pa ltar gyur @534b pas 'di la drod byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the 'arising of heat'.

original: yang rang gi sems sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul can du byas nas ltos pa dang mi ltos pa ni /
analyzed: yang rang gi sems sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul can du byas nas ltos pa dang mi ltos pa ni /
translated: Moreover, having made one's own mind the domain of the Buddha, one thinks: Whether it is dependent or not, by rubbing the stick of the mind on the wood of the Buddha's knowledge, the fire of the knowledge of omniscience will be produced.🔽This is called the 'summit'.🔽Having attained the middle path, one thinks: Whether it is manifest or not, by rubbing the stick of the mind on the wood of the Buddha's knowledge, the fire of the knowledge of omniscience will be produced.

original: ri mthon po'i rtse mor 'dzeg pa na lus bar snad la gnas pa 'dra yang 'gog gi cha sa la reg pa dang 'dra bar gyur pas 'di la rtse mor phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ri mthon po'i rtse mor 'dzeg pa na lus bar snad la gnas pa 'dra yang 'gog gi cha sa la reg pa dang 'dra bar gyur pas 'di la rtse mor phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called 'receptivity'.🔽Having attained the middle path, one thinks: Whether it is manifest or not, by rubbing the stick of the mind on the wood of the Buddha's knowledge, the fire of the knowledge of omniscience will be produced.

original: sems dang sangs rgyas mnyam par gyur cing dbu ma'i lam rnyed nas skye bo bzod pa can 'khon nang du mi 'dzin la phyir yang mngon du mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar gyur pas 'di la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sangs rgyas mnyam par gyur cing dbu ma'i lam rnyed nas skye bo bzod pa can 'khon nang du mi 'dzin la phyir yang mngon du mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar gyur pas 'di la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called 'receptivity'.

original: grangs dang tshad dang bral nas dbu ma'i lam du rig pa dang 'khyams pa gnyis mig gi spyod yul du ma gyur pa na 'di la 'jig rten gyi chos mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: grangs dang tshad dang bral nas dbu ma'i lam du rig pa dang 'khyams pa gnyis mig gi spyod yul du ma gyur pa na 'di la 'jig rten gyi chos mchog ces bya'o //
translated: When the path of the middle way is known, having been freed from numbers and measures, and when the two, knowledge and wandering, are not in the domain of the eye, this is called the supreme worldly quality.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda!

original: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu dag byang chub chen po rtogs nas rig pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ma lus pa khong du chud pa na 'di la rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rigs kyi bu dag byang chub chen po rtogs nas rig pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ma lus pa khong du chud pa na 'di la rab tu dga' ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: When sons of good family like this, having realized great awakening, have completely understood the domain of the Tathāgata with knowledge, this is called the stage of joy.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dag tha mi dad du gyur te mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin 'gag pa na 'di la dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya'o //🔽dag pa'i mthar thug nas 'od gsal ba skyes na 'di la 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dag tha mi dad du gyur te mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin 'gag pa na 'di la dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya'o // dag pa'i mthar thug nas 'od gsal ba skyes na 'di la 'od byed pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the various natures that are different become undifferentiated and the nature of equality ceases, this is called the stage of stainlessness.🔽When, having reached the ultimate purity, clear light is born, this is called the stage of blazing light.

original: 'od gsal ba mthar thug nas rig pa rgyas pa na 'di la 'od 'phro ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba mthar thug nas rig pa rgyas pa na 'di la 'od 'phro ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: When, having reached the ultimate clear light, knowledge expands, this is called the stage of expanding light.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dag gis glags tshol mi nus pa na 'di la sbyangs dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o //🔽'dus ma @535a *//
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa dag gis glags tshol mi nus pa na 'di la sbyangs dka' ba'i sa zhes bya'o // 'dus ma @535a *//
translated: When it is no longer possible for either equality or inequality to find an opportunity, this is called the difficult to conquer stage.

original: byas kyi yang dag pa'i rang bzhin mngon du gyur pa na 'di la mngon du gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byas kyi yang dag pa'i rang bzhin mngon du gyur pa na 'di la mngon du gyur pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the nature of the unconditioned is manifested, this is called the manifest stage.

original: yang dag pa'i mthar phyin pa na 'di la ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mthar phyin pa na 'di la ring du song ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one reaches the end of the right path, this is called the far-reaching stage.

original: yang dag pa'i sems tsam du gyur pa na 'di la mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sems tsam du gyur pa na 'di la mi g-yo ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind becomes only right, this is called the immovable stage.

original: yang dag pa las chos kyi longs spyod rgyas par byed nus pa na 'di la legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa las chos kyi longs spyod rgyas par byed nus pa na 'di la legs pa'i blo gros kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is able to expand the enjoyment of the Dharma from the right path, this is called the stage of excellent wisdom.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di nas tshogs lam gyi bar sgom pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams shing yon tan gyi dpal rdzogs nas 'di dag la sogs pa la sgom pa la slob pa'i rim pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di nas tshogs lam gyi bar sgom pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams shing yon tan gyi dpal rdzogs nas 'di dag la sogs pa la sgom pa la slob pa'i rim pa zhes bya'o //
translated: from here, when bodhisattvas have begun to cultivate the path of accumulation and so forth, and have completed the glory of good qualities, this is called the stage of training in cultivation and so forth.

original: snying rje'i grib ma can rmad du byung ba'i sprin mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgya mtsho g-yogs pas 'di la chos kyi sprin gyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i grib ma can rmad du byung ba'i sprin mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgya mtsho g-yogs pas 'di la chos kyi sprin gyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cloud of the marvelous compassion that covers the ocean of nirvana is called the stage of the cloud of Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhi bar gzhol ba'i rgyun las ldog cing byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag rgyun dang mthun par phyin nas rig pa la reg cing 'dres pa na 'di la mnyam nyid kyi rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhi bar gzhol ba'i rgyun las ldog cing byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag rgyun dang mthun par phyin nas rig pa la reg cing 'dres pa na 'di la mnyam nyid kyi rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata turns away from the stream that flows to peace, and these bodhisattvas, flowing with the stream, reach the end of the stream and touch the knowledge of sameness. This is called the knowledge of sameness.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: shes rab rkyang pa'i sems nas mnyam pa nyid kyi rig pa'i bar thob nas rig pa 'di thog mar rdo rje lta bu'i sems thob pa la shes rab rkyang pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab rkyang pa'i sems nas mnyam pa nyid kyi rig pa'i bar thob nas rig pa 'di thog mar rdo rje lta bu'i sems thob pa la shes rab rkyang pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: from the mind of mere wisdom up to the knowledge of sameness, having attained this knowledge, this is called the stage of mere wisdom, which is the first attainment of the vajra-like mind.

original: 'di ltar rim pa rim par brgyud nas ya dang srung rim pa bcu gnyis 'das nas gdod rmad du byung ba'i rig pa rdzogs @535b shing bla na med pa'i lam grub bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rim pa rim par brgyud nas ya dang srung rim pa bcu gnyis 'das nas gdod rmad du byung ba'i rig pa rdzogs @535b shing bla na med pa'i lam grub bo //
translated: In this way, passing through the twelve stages in order, one finally completes the marvelous knowledge and attains the unsurpassed path.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sa 'di dag thams cad so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje sgyu ma'i dpe zab mo rnam pa bcu bzung ste zhi gnas la gnas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi lhag mthong gi stobs kyis rnam par dag pa'i sgom
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sa 'di dag thams cad so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje sgyu ma'i dpe zab mo rnam pa bcu bzung ste zhi gnas la gnas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi lhag mthong gi stobs kyis rnam par dag pa'i sgom
translated: All these various stages are taken up by the vajra of discerning wisdom, which is like a profound illusion with ten aspects.

original: pa la rim gyis 'jug go /
analyzed: pa la rim gyis 'jug go /
translated: Abiding in śamatha, one gradually enters into the meditation that is purified by the vipaśyanā of all the tathāgatas.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di lta bu thams cad rgyu rnam pa gsum mi 'der bar sbyangs pas de lta bu'i lam gyi rim pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga la brten nas yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi go 'phang rdzogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu thams cad rgyu rnam pa gsum mi 'der bar sbyangs pas de lta bu'i lam gyi rim pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga la brten nas yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi go 'phang rdzogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: all of this is accomplished by the power of the three causes. In this way, based on the fifty-five stages of the path, the state of perfect awakening is accomplished.

original: 'di ltar sgom pa la yang dag par sgom pa zhes bya la gal te gzhan du sgom na log par sgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgom pa la yang dag par sgom pa zhes bya la gal te gzhan du sgom na log par sgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This kind of meditation is called “correct meditation.” If it is practiced in another way, it is called “incorrect meditation.”

original: de'i tshe chos kyi rgyal po'i sras 'jam pa'i dbyangs de ma thag tu 'khor 'dus pa chen po'i nang nas stan las langs te de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi rgyal po'i sras 'jam pa'i dbyangs de ma thag tu 'khor 'dus pa chen po'i nang nas stan las langs te de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol pa /
translated: At that time, Mañjuśrī, the son of the Dharma King, immediately rose from his seat in the great assembly, bowed to the feet of the Tathāgata, and made this request:

original: chos 'di'i ming ci zhes bya /
analyzed: chos 'di'i ming ci zhes bya /
translated: What is the name of this Dharma?🔽How should I and sentient beings uphold it?

original: bdag dang / sems can rnams kyis ji ltar bzung bar bgyi zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can rnams kyis ji ltar bzung bar bgyi zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
