analyzed: sems gshis cha bdun pa dang sems pa cha gsum pa yin na chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og tu skyes nas me 'bar ba'i drod kyis lus bskams nas yi dvags su gyur te rgyun du mes tshig par 'gyur la chu 'thung du song ba na gzhan gyis gsod par
translated: If there are seven mental factors and three volitions, one is born under the water wheel. The heat of the burning fire dries up the body and one becomes a hungry ghost. One is constantly burned by fire and when one goes to drink water, others kill one.

original: 'gyur te / 'di ltar bza' btung mi rnyed par bskal pa brgya stong 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur te / 'di ltar bza' btung mi rnyed par bskal pa brgya stong 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one does not find food and drink and one hundred thousand eons pass.

original: sems gshis cha dgu pa dang sems pa cha gcig pa yin na me'i dkyil 'khor 'das nas me dang rlung gi mtshams su zhugs nas rnam smin yang ba dag ni /
analyzed: sems gshis cha dgu pa dang sems pa cha gcig pa yin na me'i dkyil 'khor 'das nas me dang rlung gi mtshams su zhugs nas rnam smin yang ba dag ni /
translated: If there are nine mental factors and one volition, one passes beyond the water wheel and enters between fire and wind. The light karmic maturation

original: mnar yod pa dang / lci ba dag ni /
analyzed: mnar yod pa dang / lci ba dag ni /
translated: is Saṃjīva, and the heavy one is

original: mnar med pa ste /
analyzed: mnar med pa ste /
translated: Avīci.

original: dmyal ba rigs @539a *//
analyzed: dmyal ba rigs @539a *//
translated: The type of hell

original: gnyis su skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gnyis su skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it is a mixture of the two,

original: sems gshis rkyang pa yin na mnar med pa'i dmyal bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: sems gshis rkyang pa yin na mnar med pa'i dmyal bar 'gro'o //
translated: then you will be born in the Avīci hell.

original: ltung ba po de'i sems la theg pa chen po la smod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bcas pa'i khrims gzhig pa dang / chos log par smra ba dang / sbyin bdag gi rdzas la 'dod nas zhen pas len pa dang / mi 'os pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang du len pa la sogs pa dang mtshams med pa lnga dang lci ba bcus gos na phyogs bcu'i mnar med rnams su rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba po de'i sems la theg pa chen po la smod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bcas pa'i khrims gzhig pa dang / chos log par smra ba dang / sbyin bdag gi rdzas la 'dod nas zhen pas len pa dang / mi 'os pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang du len pa la sogs pa dang mtshams med pa lnga dang lci ba bcus gos na phyogs bcu'i mnar med rnams su rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind of the one who has fallen is full of contempt for the Mahāyāna, has destroyed the rules laid down by the Buddha, has taught the Dharma falsely, has taken with desire and attachment the property of benefactors, has accepted improper gifts and honors, and so forth, and has committed the five heinous acts and the ten unwholesome actions, then you will be born in the Avīci hells of the ten directions in sequence.

original: mi dge ba'i las bsags pa'i 'bras bu'i rjes su 'brangs te sdug bsngal myong ba ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las bsags pa'i 'bras bu'i rjes su 'brangs te sdug bsngal myong ba ni /
translated: The experience of suffering that follows from the accumulation of unwholesome actions

original: rang gis bsags pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin na yang thams cad kyi spyi mthun gyi las las thog ma nas grub zin pa'i gnas yod do //
analyzed: rang gis bsags pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin na yang thams cad kyi spyi mthun gyi las las thog ma nas grub zin pa'i gnas yod do //
translated: is the result of actions that you yourself have accumulated, but there are places that have been established from the very beginning through the collective actions of all.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di dag thams cad sems can de dag rang rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bag chags rnam pa bcus rgyu byas pa'i dbang po drug po thams cad kyis rnam par smin pa myong ngo //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sems can de dag rang rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bag chags rnam pa bcus rgyu byas pa'i dbang po drug po thams cad kyis rnam par smin pa myong ngo //
translated: Since all of these are the results of the karma created by sentient beings themselves, all six faculties, which are the causes created by the ten kinds of habitual propensities, experience the results of their evolution.

original: rgyu bcu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu bcu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten causes?

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: dang po 'dod pa'i bag chags dang 'brel ba ni /
analyzed: dang po 'dod pa'i bag chags dang 'brel ba ni /
translated: first, the connection with the habitual propensities of desire

original: phan tshun du zhen pa las bskyed pa yin la rim gyis zhen bzhin du rgyun chags pa'i phyir de ltar rab tu 'bar ba'i me lce nang nas 'phro zhing 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phan tshun du zhen pa las bskyed pa yin la rim gyis zhen bzhin du rgyun chags pa'i phyir de ltar rab tu 'bar ba'i me lce nang nas 'phro zhing 'byung ngo //
translated: is generated from mutual attachment, and because of the continuity of gradual attachment, it thus spreads and arises from within the blazing flames.

original: dper na / mi'i lag pa phan tshun mnyes na dro ba'i mtshan ma mngon du 'gyur ba ltar bag chags @539b gnyis phan tshun du zhen pas de ltar lcags kyi khri dang zangs kyi ka ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
analyzed: dper na / mi'i lag pa phan tshun mnyes na dro ba'i mtshan ma mngon du 'gyur ba ltar bag chags @539b gnyis phan tshun du zhen pas de ltar lcags kyi khri dang zangs kyi ka ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
translated: For example, just as the sign of warmth manifests when one rubs one’s hands together, the result of the mutual attachment of the two habitual propensities is experienced as an iron bed and copper pillars, and so on.

original: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dod pa'i las gzigs nas 'dod chags kyi me zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'dod pa la gzigs nas me'i dong bzhin du byol nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'dod pa'i las gzigs nas 'dod chags kyi me zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'dod pa la gzigs nas me'i dong bzhin du byol nas 'gro'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgatas of the ten directions, seeing the karma of desire, designate it as the fire of desire. Bodhisattvas, seeing desire, avoid it like a pit of fire.

original: gnyis pa brnab sems kyi bag chags las rtog cing sems pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa brnab sems kyi bag chags las rtog cing sems pa ni /
translated: The second, conceptualizing and thinking from the latent tendencies of covetousness,

original: rdub pa'i rnam pa byung zhing rdub pa rgyun chags pa tshim pa med pas de ltar lhags sgang gi 'khyags pa'i nang du grang ngad kyis gas par 'gyur ro; ;dper na /
analyzed: rdub pa'i rnam pa byung zhing rdub pa rgyun chags pa tshim pa med pas de ltar lhags sgang gi 'khyags pa'i nang du grang ngad kyis gas par 'gyur ro; ;dper na /
translated: the form of inhalation arises, and the continuous inhalation is insatiable. Thus, in the midst of the cold of the winter wind, it splits open from the cold. For example,

original: mi'i kha nas dbugs nang du rdub na grang ba tshor ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi'i kha nas dbugs nang du rdub na grang ba tshor ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: when a person inhales through the mouth, they feel cold.

original: bag chags gnyis phan tshun du zil gyis mnan pas de ltar aa chu dang kyi hud dang so tham tham la sogs pa'i skad 'don zhing autpal dang padma lta bur kha dog 'gyur te 'khyags shing grang ba'i sdug bsngal myong ngo //
analyzed: bag chags gnyis phan tshun du zil gyis mnan pas de ltar aa chu dang kyi hud dang so tham tham la sogs pa'i skad 'don zhing autpal dang padma lta bur kha dog 'gyur te 'khyags shing grang ba'i sdug bsngal myong ngo //
translated: The two habitual tendencies mutually suppress each other and thus they cry out “Water!” “Alas!” “Help!” and so on and their color changes like a blue or red lotus and they experience the suffering of cold and freezing.

original: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kun tu len par 'dod pa dag gzigs nas brnab sems kyi chu bo zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams brnab sems gzigs nas dug gi rlangs pa can gyi rgya mtsho ltar byol nas 'gro'o //🔽gsum pa mthon po'i nga rgyal gyi bag chags kyis zil gyis mnan pa las phan tshun du phrag dog pas bskyed pa yin zhing 'di rgyun ma 'chad pas 'phyo @540a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kun tu len par 'dod pa dag gzigs nas brnab sems kyi chu bo zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams brnab sems gzigs nas dug gi rlangs pa can gyi rgya mtsho ltar byol nas 'gro'o // gsum pa mthon po'i nga rgyal gyi bag chags kyis zil gyis mnan pa las phan tshun du phrag dog pas bskyed pa yin zhing 'di rgyun ma 'chad pas 'phyo @540a *//
translated: Therefore, when the tathāgatas of the ten directions see those who wish to take rebirth, they designate it as the river of covetousness and bodhisattvas, seeing covetousness, avoid it like a poisonous ocean.

original: zhing 'phyur la 'khrugs pa las chu bo 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhing 'phyur la 'khrugs pa las chu bo 'byung ste /
translated: The third, the river of desire, arises from the habitual tendency of pride of superiority, which is generated by mutual envy. Since this is uninterrupted, it surges, swells and churns and thus the river arises.

original: dper na / kha nang na lce bsgyur zhing 'dril na mchil ma 'byung ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na / kha nang na lce bsgyur zhing 'dril na mchil ma 'byung ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, if you roll your tongue around in your mouth, saliva will come out.

original: bag chags 'phel bzhin pa de lta bur khrag gi klung dang / thal skya'i klung dang / bye tshan dang / dug gi mtsho dang / zangs zhun khar ldugs pa dang mid pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ngo //
analyzed: bag chags 'phel bzhin pa de lta bur khrag gi klung dang / thal skya'i klung dang / bye tshan dang / dug gi mtsho dang / zangs zhun khar ldugs pa dang mid pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ngo //
translated: In the same way, as the latent tendencies increase, you will experience the suffering of rivers of blood, rivers of ash, hot sand, poison lakes, and being forced to drink and swallow molten copper and so on.

original: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthon po'i nga rgyal la gzigs nas rmongs byed kyi chu 'thung ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthon po'i nga rgyal la gzigs nas rmongs byed kyi chu 'thung ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, the tathāgatas of the ten directions, seeing the pride of being superior, have declared it to be like drinking the water of delusion.

original: zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams mthon po'i nga rgyal gzigs nas 'dam rdzab chen po dang 'dra bar byol zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams mthon po'i nga rgyal gzigs nas 'dam rdzab chen po dang 'dra bar byol zhing 'gro'o //
translated: And the bodhisattvas, seeing the pride of being superior, have declared it to be like a great swamp.

original: bzhi pa zhe sdang gi bag chags phan tshun du 'tshe ba ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa zhe sdang gi bag chags phan tshun du 'tshe ba ni /
translated: The latent tendencies of anger

original: phan tshun mi 'dod pas bskyed pa yin zhing mi 'dod pas 'ching bzhin du ma zhin sems gdungs nas me 'bar te khro ba'i rang bzhin lcags ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun mi 'dod pas bskyed pa yin zhing mi 'dod pas 'ching bzhin du ma zhin sems gdungs nas me 'bar te khro ba'i rang bzhin lcags ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: The fire of anger burns the mind, which is tormented by the desire to harm each other, and the nature of anger is like iron.

original: de'i phyir ral gri'i ri dang / lcags kyi dbyug pa dang / shal ma li'i sdong po dang / ral gri'i 'khor lo dang / dgra sta dang / mdung dang / sog le la sogs pa dad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ral gri'i ri dang / lcags kyi dbyug pa dang / shal ma li'i sdong po dang / ral gri'i 'khor lo dang / dgra sta dang / mdung dang / sog le la sogs pa dad 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, there are mountains of swords, iron clubs, Śālmali trees, disks of swords, axes, spears, saws, and so on.

original: dper na / mi dag sha 'khon du gyur te phan tshun gsod pa dang zhe sdang ba ltar bag chags gnyis kyis phan tshun gsod pas de ltar dpal bcom te mgo gcod pa dang / dus bur byed pa dang / 'bugs pa dang / bsnun @540b pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ngo //
analyzed: dper na / mi dag sha 'khon du gyur te phan tshun gsod pa dang zhe sdang ba ltar bag chags gnyis kyis phan tshun gsod pas de ltar dpal bcom te mgo gcod pa dang / dus bur byed pa dang / 'bugs pa dang / bsnun @540b pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal myong ngo //
translated: Just as people who have become enemies kill each other and hate each other, the two latent tendencies kill each other, and so they experience the suffering of being beheaded, having their heads cut off, being cut up, being stabbed, and so on.

original: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhe sdang gzigs nas ral gri rnon po zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhe sdang gzigs nas gsod pa po dang 'dra bar byol nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhe sdang gzigs nas ral gri rnon po zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhe sdang gzigs nas gsod pa po dang 'dra bar byol nas 'gro'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagatas of the ten directions, seeing hatred, designate it as a sharp sword, and the Bodhisattvas, seeing hatred, avoid it as if it were a murderer.

original: lnga pa g-yo sgyu'i bag chags kyis phan tshun du bslu ba ni /
analyzed: lnga pa g-yo sgyu'i bag chags kyis phan tshun du bslu ba ni /
translated: The fifth, the perfuming of deceit, is mutual deception.

original: phan tshun du gyod slong ba las bskyed pa yin zhing 'phel zhing rgyun chags pa las de lta bur thag pas bkyig pa dang / shing gis bcu pa dang / nan tur byed pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phan tshun du gyod slong ba las bskyed pa yin zhing 'phel zhing rgyun chags pa las de lta bur thag pas bkyig pa dang / shing gis bcu pa dang / nan tur byed pa la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: It is produced from mutual litigation, and from its increase and continuity, such things as ropes, sticks, and punishments arise.

original: dper na / zhing la chu drangs te rtsa shing bskyed pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na / zhing la chu drangs te rtsa shing bskyed pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like water being led into a field to grow grass and trees.

original: bag chags gnyis phan tshun du 'phel bas de ltar rkang lag lcags sgrog dang / bsdos bskon pa dang / ber ka dang / lcags thag gis bsdams pa dang / lcag tshan dang; dbyug pa dang / be con la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
analyzed: bag chags gnyis phan tshun du 'phel bas de ltar rkang lag lcags sgrog dang / bsdos bskon pa dang / ber ka dang / lcags thag gis bsdams pa dang / lcag tshan dang; dbyug pa dang / be con la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
translated: The two habitual tendencies increase in relation to each other, and so one experiences the results of being bound by iron chains, bound by ropes, bound by whips, bound by iron chains, bound by whips, bound by sticks, bound by clubs, and so forth.

original: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams g-yo sgyu gzigs nas g-yo can gyi rkun po zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams g-yo sgyu can la gzigs nas 'phar ba dang 'dra mar 'jigs shing skrag go /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams g-yo sgyu gzigs nas g-yo can gyi rkun po zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams g-yo sgyu can la gzigs nas 'phar ba dang 'dra mar 'jigs shing skrag go /
translated: Therefore, the tathāgatas of the ten directions see deceit and hypocrisy, and they designate the deceitful and hypocritical as thieves. Bodhisattvas see the deceitful and hypocritical as terrifying and frightening, like a wolf.

original: drug pa phan tshun du rdzun gyis bslu ba'i bag chags ni /
analyzed: drug pa phan tshun du rdzun gyis bslu ba'i bag chags ni /
translated: The sixth is the habitual tendency to deceive each other with lies.

original: phan tshun du co 'dri bas skyon 'dogs shing tshul de mi gtong bar g-yo sgyu'i bsam pa skyed pa de ltar rdul dang bshad gci dang // dri nga ba dang / mi gtsang ba sogs 'byung @541a *//
analyzed: phan tshun du co 'dri bas skyon 'dogs shing tshul de mi gtong bar g-yo sgyu'i bsam pa skyed pa de ltar rdul dang bshad gci dang // dri nga ba dang / mi gtsang ba sogs 'byung @541a *//
translated: Because of the mutual taunting, one criticizes the other, and without letting go of that attitude, one generates a deceitful thought. In that way, dust, excrement, urine, bad smells, impurities, and so forth arise.

original: ngo; ;dper na /
analyzed: ngo; ;dper na /
translated: For example,

original: rlung gis rdul 'tshubs langs te mi mthong ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rlung gis rdul 'tshubs langs te mi mthong ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the wind stirring up dust so that one cannot see.

original: bag chags gnyis 'phel nas de ltar 'dam du ltung zhing 'phyo ba dang / skyur ba dang / 'phur ba dang / 'bab pa dang / rgyun gyis 'khyer ba dang / bying ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
analyzed: bag chags gnyis 'phel nas de ltar 'dam du ltung zhing 'phyo ba dang / skyur ba dang / 'phur ba dang / 'bab pa dang / rgyun gyis 'khyer ba dang / bying ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
translated: The two habitual tendencies increase, and one experiences the results of sinking in the mud, floating, vomiting, flying, falling, being carried away by a current, sinking, and so forth.

original: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams g-yo sgyu byed pa dang bslu ba gzigs nas chom rkun gyis gsod pa dang 'dra zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams g-yo sgyu gzigs nas dug sprul rkang 'og tu tshud pa dang 'dra bar sems so
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams g-yo sgyu byed pa dang bslu ba gzigs nas chom rkun gyis gsod pa dang 'dra zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams g-yo sgyu gzigs nas dug sprul rkang 'og tu tshud pa dang 'dra bar sems so
translated: Therefore, the tathāgatas of the ten directions see deceit and lying as being like being killed by a robber, and they label it as such. Bodhisattvas see deceit and lying as being like a poisonous snake underfoot.

analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sha 'khon can gyi skye bo gzigs nas log par gnod @541b ba'i 'dre zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sha 'khon can gyi skye bo gzigs nas dug gi chang 'thung ba dang 'dra bar sems so
translated: Therefore, when the Tathāgatas of the ten directions see those who are spiteful, they designate them as “demons who harm wrongly.” When bodhisattvas see those who are spiteful, they think of them as being like those who drink poisoned wine.

original: // brgyad pa lta ba'i bag chags kyis phan tshun gsal ba ni /
analyzed: // brgyad pa lta ba'i bag chags kyis phan tshun gsal ba ni /
translated: The eighth, the mutual clarification of the latent tendencies of views, is as follows.

original: nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang / lta ba'i 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'du shes log pa'i rigs sdig pa'i 'bras bu thams cad phyin ci log las bskyed nas so sor phyung ba ni /
analyzed: nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang / lta ba'i 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'du shes log pa'i rigs sdig pa'i 'bras bu thams cad phyin ci log las bskyed nas so sor phyung ba ni /
translated: The various kinds of grasping at “I,” grasping at views, grasping at the superiority of moral discipline and religious austerities, and wrong ideas—all these produce the results of evil and are extracted individually.

original: phan tshun du rgol ba las byung ngo //
analyzed: phan tshun du rgol ba las byung ngo //
translated: They arise from mutual conflict.

original: de ltar gshin rje'i pho nya dang las byad pa yi ge dpang rgya 'dzin pa dag yod do //
analyzed: de ltar gshin rje'i pho nya dang las byad pa yi ge dpang rgya 'dzin pa dag yod do //
translated: Thus, the messengers of Yama and the witnesses who hold the written records of one’s actions exist.

original: dper na / lam du 'gro ba'i mi gcig gis gcig lta ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na / lam du 'gro ba'i mi gcig gis gcig lta ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like, for example, one traveler seeing another on the road.

original: bag chags gnyis phan tshun du mthun pas de ltar dbang rgya 'dzin pa dag gis g-yo sgyu la rtog pa dang / 'dri ba dang / nan tur byed pa dang / rtsa ba tshol ba dang / phra zhing zhib par byed pa dang / legs nyes 'byed pa'i lha dang 'dre dag gi lag tu yi ge bzung nas so sor 'byed pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro; ;de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams lta ba ngan pa gzigs nas lta ba'i dong zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: bag chags gnyis phan tshun du mthun pas de ltar dbang rgya 'dzin pa dag gis g-yo sgyu la rtog pa dang / 'dri ba dang / nan tur byed pa dang / rtsa ba tshol ba dang / phra zhing zhib par byed pa dang / legs nyes 'byed pa'i lha dang 'dre dag gi lag tu yi ge bzung nas so sor 'byed pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro; ;de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams lta ba ngan pa gzigs nas lta ba'i dong zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa'
translated: The thus-gone ones of the ten directions see these wrong views and label them the “abyss of views.”

original: rnams 'di lta bu bden pa ma yin pa'i stong pa la log par bzung ba gzigs nas dug gi gcong rong dang 'dra bar sems so //
analyzed: rnams 'di lta bu bden pa ma yin pa'i stong pa la log par bzung ba gzigs nas dug gi gcong rong dang 'dra bar sems so //
translated: The bodhisattvas see how people grasp at such unreal emptinesses and think of them as a “poisonous pit.”

original: dgu pa bsnyon pa'i bag chags phan tshun du sgro 'dogs pa ni /
analyzed: dgu pa bsnyon pa'i bag chags phan tshun du sgro 'dogs pa ni /
translated: The ninth is the mutual superimposition of the habitual tendencies of denial.

original: @542a *// bsnyon te ngan du smra ba las bskyed pa yin zhing de'i phyir ris btsir ba dang / rdobs btsir ba dang / mchig dang rang thag gis 'thag pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
analyzed: @542a *// bsnyon te ngan du smra ba las bskyed pa yin zhing de'i phyir ris btsir ba dang / rdobs btsir ba dang / mchig dang rang thag gis 'thag pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
translated: and the result of that is the experience of being pressed, crushed, pounded, and so on.

original: dper na / skye bo mi srun pas skye bo rang bzhin drang po la nyes pa med par bsnyon 'dzugs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na / skye bo mi srun pas skye bo rang bzhin drang po la nyes pa med par bsnyon 'dzugs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the case of a wicked person falsely accusing an honest person of a crime.

original: bag chags gnyis phan tshun du 'brel bas de ltar bsrung ba dang / 'tshe ba dang / brdeg pa dang / lcid kyis non pa dang / btsir ba dang / dbyang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
analyzed: bag chags gnyis phan tshun du 'brel bas de ltar bsrung ba dang / 'tshe ba dang / brdeg pa dang / lcid kyis non pa dang / btsir ba dang / dbyang ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu myong ngo //
translated: The result of the mutual interaction of the two residual impressions is the experience of being guarded, harmed, beaten, oppressed, crushed, and so on.

original: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gshe zhing bsnyon pa dag gzigs nas mi srun pa zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsnyon pa dag gzigs nas thog babs pa dang 'dra bar blta'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gshe zhing bsnyon pa dag gzigs nas mi srun pa zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsnyon pa dag gzigs nas thog babs pa dang 'dra bar blta'o //
translated: Therefore, when the Tathagatas of the ten directions see the false accusations of the wicked, they designate them as wicked people, and when the Bodhisattvas see the false accusations, they regard them as a thunderbolt.

original: bcu pa sher sbyang gi bag chags phan tshun du rtsod pa ni /
analyzed: bcu pa sher sbyang gi bag chags phan tshun du rtsod pa ni /
translated: The tenth is the dispute about the mutual conflict of the instincts of learning.

original: gsang zhing sbas pas bskyed pa yin zhing de'i phyir me long ston pa dang / 'od kyis snang bar byed pa dag yod do //
analyzed: gsang zhing sbas pas bskyed pa yin zhing de'i phyir me long ston pa dang / 'od kyis snang bar byed pa dag yod do //
translated: It is produced by secret concealment, and therefore the mirror and the light exist.

original: dper na / nyi ma'i grib ma sbed mi thub pa dang 'dra'o //🔽bag chags gnyis phan tshun 'brel bas de lta bu sha 'khon can gyi dgra dang grogs ngan pa dang sdig pa ston pa'i me long dang nor bu sgron mes ring nas bsags pa'i sdig pa rnams rnam par gsal bar byas te mtshan ma ston pa la sogs pa'i
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i grib ma sbed mi thub pa dang 'dra'o // bag chags gnyis phan tshun 'brel bas de lta bu sha 'khon can gyi dgra dang grogs ngan pa dang sdig pa ston pa'i me long dang nor bu sgron mes ring nas bsags pa'i sdig pa rnams rnam par gsal bar byas te mtshan ma ston pa la sogs pa'i
translated: For example, it is like the impossibility of hiding the shadow of the sun.

original: 'bras bu myong ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu myong ngo //
translated: The two instincts are mutually related, and thus the mirror of the bad friend who is a hostile enemy, and the lamp of the jewel of the teacher of sin, reveal the sins accumulated over a long time, and the signs of the experience of the result are shown.

original: de'i phyir @542b phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang skyon gsang zhing sbed pa gzigs nas rkun ma g-yo can zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbed pa la gzigs nas ri chen po spyi bor khur nas rgya mtsho'i nang du gom pa 'god
analyzed: de'i phyir @542b phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang skyon gsang zhing sbed pa gzigs nas rkun ma g-yo can zhes gdags par mdzad cing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbed pa la gzigs nas ri chen po spyi bor khur nas rgya mtsho'i nang du gom pa 'god
translated: Therefore, the tathāgatas of the ten directions, seeing that one conceals and hides one’s own faults, designate one as a “thief” and a “deceiver.”

original: pa dang 'dra bar blta'o //
analyzed: pa dang 'dra bar blta'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas, seeing that one conceals, view one as being like someone who carries a great mountain on his head and then takes a step into the ocean.

original: rnam par smin pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six fruitional [results]?

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: sems can thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa drug gis las bsags nas sdig pa'i 'bras bu ni dbang lo drug las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa drug gis las bsags nas sdig pa'i 'bras bu ni dbang lo drug las 'byung ngo //
translated: all sentient beings accumulate karma through the six consciousnesses, and the results of evil deeds arise from the six sense faculties.

original: ji ltar sdig pa'i 'bras bu dbang po drug las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdig pa'i 'bras bu dbang po drug las 'byung zhe na /
translated: How do the results of evil deeds arise from the six sense faculties?

original: dang po mthong ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: dang po mthong ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: First, the results of evil deeds arise from the condition of the fruitional eye.

original: mthong ba 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na phyogs bcur me 'bar bas gang ba mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mthong ba 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na phyogs bcur me 'bar bas gang ba mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When death approaches, in accordance with the ripening of this karma, one sees the ten directions filled with blazing fire.

original: 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes du ba steng 'og tu 'gro ba'i rjes su zhugs nas mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes du ba steng 'og tu 'gro ba'i rjes su zhugs nas mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After the consciousness of one who dies and transmigrates enters the smoke that moves above and below, one falls into Avīci. Two signs appear.

original: dang po gsal ba'i mtshan ma ni; mi sdug pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs mang po mthong zhing tshad med pa'i 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dang po gsal ba'i mtshan ma ni; mi sdug pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs mang po mthong zhing tshad med pa'i 'jigs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The first is a sign of clarity: one sees many kinds of unpleasant things and experiences immeasurable fear.

original: gnyis pa mi gsal ba'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa mi gsal ba'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The second is a sign of obscurity:

original: mun pa mun nag gang yang mi mthong zhing tshad med pa'i skrag pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mun pa mun nag gang yang mi mthong zhing tshad med pa'i skrag pa 'byung ngo //
translated: one sees nothing at all in the pitch darkness and experiences immeasurable fear.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i sems mnyan pa bsregs pa na zangs zhun khol mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i sems mnyan pa bsregs pa na zangs zhun khol mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, when the mind that sees is burned by the hot copper, it becomes boiling molten copper.

original: dbugs bsegs pa na du ba nag po dang na bun smug po @543a *//
analyzed: dbugs bsegs pa na du ba nag po dang na bun smug po @543a *//
translated: When one inhales, it is black smoke and brown mist.

original: 'gyur ro // bro ba bsregs pa na lcags bsregs kyi ril bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // bro ba bsregs pa na lcags bsregs kyi ril bur 'gyur ro //
translated: When the taste is burned, it becomes a red-hot iron pill.

original: reg pa bsregs pa nam ma mur dang sol mer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa bsregs pa nam ma mur dang sol mer 'gyur ro //
translated: When the touch is burned, it becomes a red-hot iron ball or a red-hot iron plate.

original: sems bsregs pa na me stag kun tu 'phro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bsregs pa na me stag kun tu 'phro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is burned, it becomes a red-hot iron ball or a red-hot iron plate.

original: gnyis pa thos pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: gnyis pa thos pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: Second, the result of evil arises from the condition of the ripening of hearing.

original: thos pa 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar rba rlabs 'phyur bas sa dang nam mkha' gang ba mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: thos pa 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar rba rlabs 'phyur bas sa dang nam mkha' gang ba mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When the ripening of this hearing is about to die, first a wave arises, filling the earth and sky.

original: 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes rgyun gyi shugs kyis mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes rgyun gyi shugs kyis mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the consciousness of one who has died and transmigrated falls into Avīci by the force of the stream. Two signs appear.

original: dang po mnyan pa na ku co sna tshogs pa thos shing sems rmongs shing 'khrugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po mnyan pa na ku co sna tshogs pa thos shing sems rmongs shing 'khrugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: First, when listening, one hears various noises, and the mind becomes confused and agitated.

original: gnyis pa mnyan pa bkag na sgra med par gyur te mi gsal zhing bying bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa mnyan pa bkag na sgra med par gyur te mi gsal zhing bying bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Second, when listening is blocked, the sound disappears, becoming unclear and sinking.

original: de'i phyir thos pa'i rba klong du thos pa nub na nyes pa brjod cing chad pa gcod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thos pa'i rba klong du thos pa nub na nyes pa brjod cing chad pa gcod do //
translated: Therefore, if the ocean of learning is destroyed, the faults are described and punished.

original: mthong ba nub na 'brug gi nga ro sgrog cing dug gi rlangs pa 'thib bo //
analyzed: mthong ba nub na 'brug gi nga ro sgrog cing dug gi rlangs pa 'thib bo //
translated: If sight is destroyed, the sound of thunder resounds and the vapor of poison spreads.

original: dbugs nub na char dang na bun dang srin bu gdug ba can babs nas lus gang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs nub na char dang na bun dang srin bu gdug ba can babs nas lus gang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If breath is destroyed, rain, mist, and poisonous insects fall and fill the body.

original: ro nub na rnag khrag tu gyur cing sna tshogs pa'i mi gtsang ba dang dri nga bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro nub na rnag khrag tu gyur cing sna tshogs pa'i mi gtsang ba dang dri nga bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If taste is destroyed, it becomes pus and blood and various impurities and bad smells.

original: reg bya nub na srog chags dang 'dre dang bshang gci'i rdzab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg bya nub na srog chags dang 'dre dang bshang gci'i rdzab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If touch is destroyed, it becomes a swamp of living beings, ghosts, and excrement.

original: yid nub na glog dang ser ba babs te snying gas par @543b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid nub na glog dang ser ba babs te snying gas par @543b 'gyur ro //
translated: If mind is destroyed, lightning and hail fall and the heart breaks.

original: gsum pa snom pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: gsum pa snom pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: Third, the ripening condition of smelling produces the result of evil.

original: snom pa 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar dug gi rlangs pas phyogs thams cad gang zhing 'khrigs pa mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: snom pa 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar dug gi rlangs pas phyogs thams cad gang zhing 'khrigs pa mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When death approaches, the one who smells will first see the smoke of poison filling and pervading all directions.

original: 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes sa la 'dzul zhing byung ste mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes sa la 'dzul zhing byung ste mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the consciousness of one who has died and transmigrated enters the ground, it falls into Avīci. Two signs appear.

original: dang po thos na sna tshogs pa'i dug gi rlangs pas bdugs nas sems rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po thos na sna tshogs pa'i dug gi rlangs pas bdugs nas sems rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: First, when it hears the smell of various poisons, it becomes confused.

original: gnyis pa thos pa thogs pa na dbugs 'gag cing 'thums nas 'chi ba la thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa thos pa thogs pa na dbugs 'gag cing 'thums nas 'chi ba la thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Second, when it hears the sound of being obstructed, it is choked and suffocated, and it dies.

original: de'i phyir snom pa'i dri dbugs la phog na rgol ba dang brdzi bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir snom pa'i dri dbugs la phog na rgol ba dang brdzi bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, when the smell of the one who smells hits the breath, it is attacked and trampled.

original: mthong ba la phog na me dang 'od du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba la phog na me dang 'od du 'gyur ro //
translated: When it hits the sight, it becomes fire and light.

original: mnyan pa la phog na zangs zhun khol ma dang phyi sa'i rdzab tu bying bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyan pa la phog na zangs zhun khol ma dang phyi sa'i rdzab tu bying bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it hits the hearing, it becomes molten copper and a swamp of feces.

original: ro la phog na rul ba dang myags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro la phog na rul ba dang myags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it strikes the tongue, it will rot and decay.

original: reg bya la phog na shin tu rul nas sha'i ri bo chen por gyur te bug pa brgya stong gi nang du srin bu grangs med pas gzhibs nas zos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg bya la phog na shin tu rul nas sha'i ri bo chen por gyur te bug pa brgya stong gi nang du srin bu grangs med pas gzhibs nas zos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it strikes the body, it will rot completely and become a great mountain of flesh, and countless worms will infest and eat it from within its hundreds of thousands of orifices.

original: sems pa la phog na thal ba dang dug gi rlangs pa dang rdo char dang bye ma'i char gyis btab nas ma rungs par byed do //
analyzed: sems pa la phog na thal ba dang dug gi rlangs pa dang rdo char dang bye ma'i char gyis btab nas ma rungs par byed do //
translated: If it strikes the mind, it will be afflicted by a rain of ashes, poisonous vapors, stones, and sand.

original: bzhi pa ro'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ro'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: Fourth, the condition of the ripening of taste is the arising of the result of evil.

original: ro 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar lcags kyi dra ba'i rgya las me shin tu 'bar nas @544a *//
analyzed: ro 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar lcags kyi dra ba'i rgya las me shin tu 'bar nas @544a *//
translated: In accordance with the ripening of this taste, when death is near, first a great fire will blaze from an iron net.

original: 'jig rten thams cad gang ba mthong bar 'gyur zhing 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes lcags kyi dra ba dral nas spyi'u tshugs su mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad gang ba mthong bar 'gyur zhing 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes lcags kyi dra ba dral nas spyi'u tshugs su mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be seen filling the entire world, and the consciousness of one who dies and transmigrates will be torn by the iron net, fall headfirst into Avīci, and two signs will appear.

original: dang po dbugs rdub pas 'khyags rom du gyur nas grang bas lus gas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po dbugs rdub pas 'khyags rom du gyur nas grang bas lus gas par 'gyur ro //
translated: First, when you inhale, it becomes ice and your body splits open from the cold.

original: gnyis pa dbugs 'byung ba'i tshe 'thor nas me rab tu 'bar bar gyur te rus pa dang rkang gi bar du rlag par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis pa dbugs 'byung ba'i tshe 'thor nas me rab tu 'bar bar gyur te rus pa dang rkang gi bar du rlag par byed do //
translated: Second, when you exhale, it scatters and becomes a raging fire that destroys everything down to the bones and marrow.

original: de'i phyir ro myong ba'i tshe ro la smin na bsran zhing bzod dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro myong ba'i tshe ro la smin na bsran zhing bzod dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it ripens on the tongue, you must endure the taste.

original: mthong ba la smin na rdo sreg dang lcags sreg la bldag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba la smin na rdo sreg dang lcags sreg la bldag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it ripens on the eyes, you must endure looking at burning stones and burning iron.

original: mnyan pa la smin na mtshon rnon por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyan pa la smin na mtshon rnon por 'gyur ro //
translated: If it ripens on the ears, you must endure sharp weapons.

original: dbugs la smin na lcags kyi sgrom chen por gyur te 'jig rten gyi khams g-yogs par nus so //
analyzed: dbugs la smin na lcags kyi sgrom chen por gyur te 'jig rten gyi khams g-yogs par nus so //
translated: If it ripens on the breath, you must endure a great iron box that can cover the entire world.

original: reg pa la smin na mda' gzhu dang sa mda' dag gis 'phog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa la smin na mda' gzhu dang sa mda' dag gis 'phog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it ripens on touch, you must endure being struck by arrows and spears.

original: sems pa la smin na lcags sreg gi char pa 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems pa la smin na lcags sreg gi char pa 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it ripens on the mind, you must endure a rain of burning iron.

original: lnga pa reg pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: lnga pa reg pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: Fifth, the ripened condition of touch produces the result of evil.

original: reg pa 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar phyogs bzhi nas ri chen po bzhis btsir ba mthong zhing phyir thon pa'i lam rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar phyogs bzhi nas ri chen po bzhis btsir ba mthong zhing phyir thon pa'i lam rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When death is near, in accordance with the ripening of this contact, one first sees four great mountains closing in from the four directions, and one finds no way to escape.

original: shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes lcags kyi ra ba mthong nas kha nas me 'bar ba'i @544b sbrul dang khyi dang stag dang spyang ki dang sengge dang dmyal srung gi gshin rje glang mgo dang srin po rta mgo can rnams mdung rtse gsum bzung nas lcags kyi ra ba'i
analyzed: shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes lcags kyi ra ba mthong nas kha nas me 'bar ba'i @544b sbrul dang khyi dang stag dang spyang ki dang sengge dang dmyal srung gi gshin rje glang mgo dang srin po rta mgo can rnams mdung rtse gsum bzung nas lcags kyi ra ba'i
translated: When the consciousness of one who has died sees an iron fence, snakes, dogs, tigers, wolves, lions, and Yama's henchmen with ox heads and rākṣasas with horse heads, holding tridents, drive it from the gate of the iron fence

original: sgo nang du bdas te mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgo nang du bdas te mnar med du lhung nas mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: into Avīci, two signs appear.

original: dang po reg pa dang mthun pa ni /
analyzed: dang po reg pa dang mthun pa ni /
translated: The first, in accordance with contact,

original: ri gnyis kyis btsir zhing rus pa dang sha dang khrag phyir 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ri gnyis kyis btsir zhing rus pa dang sha dang khrag phyir 'byung ngo //
translated: is that the bones, flesh, and blood are squeezed out by two mountains.

original: gnyis pa reg pa dang 'bral ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa reg pa dang 'bral ba ni /
translated: The second, in accordance with separation from contact,🔽is that the body is burned by a great fire.

original: gri dang ral gri lus la gzir nas snying dang mchin pa dum bur byed do //
analyzed: gri dang ral gri lus la gzir nas snying dang mchin pa dum bur byed do //
translated: The sword and the razor-edge cut the body, the heart and the liver into pieces.

original: de'i phyir mthun pa'i reg pa reg pa dang 'phrad na lam dang sgo khang dang khrims khang dang cog stags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthun pa'i reg pa reg pa dang 'phrad na lam dang sgo khang dang khrims khang dang cog stags su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one meets with a suitable contact, the path, the courtyard, the court, and the bench become (the hell of) sword and razor-edge.

original: mthong ba dang 'phrad na sreg cing 'tshig go /
analyzed: mthong ba dang 'phrad na sreg cing 'tshig go /
translated: If one meets with a suitable sight, one is burned and scorched.

original: mnyan pa dang 'phrad na brdung ba dang brdeg pa dang gzir ba dang snun par byed do //
analyzed: mnyan pa dang 'phrad na brdung ba dang brdeg pa dang gzir ba dang snun par byed do //
translated: If one meets with a suitable sound, one is beaten, struck, crushed, and wounded.

original: dbugs dang 'phrad na dkris pa dang sbubs su 'dzud par byed do //🔽ro dang 'phrad na rmo ba dang kha skam pas 'byed pa dang gcod pa dang dum bur byed do //
analyzed: dbugs dang 'phrad na dkris pa dang sbubs su 'dzud par byed do // ro dang 'phrad na rmo ba dang kha skam pas 'byed pa dang gcod pa dang dum bur byed do //
translated: If one meets with a suitable smell, one is wrapped and enclosed in a sheath.🔽If one meets with a suitable taste, one is plowed and split by the drying up of the mouth, cut and torn to pieces.

original: sems pa dang 'phrad na gyen du 'byung ba dang 'og tu bying ba dang 'tshed pa dang sreg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems pa dang 'phrad na gyen du 'byung ba dang 'og tu bying ba dang 'tshed pa dang sreg par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one meets with a suitable thought, one rises up, sinks down, is boiled and burned.

original: drug pa sems pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: drug pa sems pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: The sixth, the condition of the ripening of thought, produces the fruit of evil.

original: sems pa 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar rlung ma rungs pa yul khams kyi gnas dag gshig cing ldang ba mthong zhing 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes rlung gis nam mkha' la @545a *//
analyzed: sems pa 'di'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun par 'chi ba la nye ba na thog mar rlung ma rungs pa yul khams kyi gnas dag gshig cing ldang ba mthong zhing 'di la shi 'phos pa'i rnam shes rlung gis nam mkha' la @545a *//
translated: When death is near, in accordance with the ripening of this thought, one first sees the inauspicious wind rising up to destroy the realm. The consciousness of one who has died and transmigrated is carried by the wind into space.

original: khyer nas rjes su mthun par babs nas rlung gi mthus mnar med du lhung ste mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyer nas rjes su mthun par babs nas rlung gi mthus mnar med du lhung ste mtshan ma gnyis snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Falling down in accordance with the wind, by the power of the wind one falls into Avīci. Two signs appear.🔽First, consciousness is very agitated and cannot bear it, running and fleeing without rest.

original: dang po rig pa shin tu 'khyams nas ma bzod de mi dal bar bros shing byol bar byed do; ;gnyis pa rig pa mi 'khyams par sdug bsngal drag po tshor zhing shin tu tsha bar bsreg pa dang 'tshed pa'i zug rdu bzod mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po rig pa shin tu 'khyams nas ma bzod de mi dal bar bros shing byol bar byed do; ;gnyis pa rig pa mi 'khyams par sdug bsngal drag po tshor zhing shin tu tsha bar bsreg pa dang 'tshed pa'i zug rdu bzod mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Second, consciousness is not agitated, but one feels intense suffering, and cannot bear the pain of being burned and boiled.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log gis sems pa bcings na gnas gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log gis sems pa bcings na gnas gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the mind is bound by error, it becomes a basis.

original: mthong ba bcings na dbang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba bcings na dbang por 'gyur ro //
translated: If seeing is bound, it becomes a sense faculty.

original: mnyan pa bcings na 'tshir ba'i rdo chen po dang 'khyags pa dang ba mo dang rdul dang na bun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyan pa bcings na 'tshir ba'i rdo chen po dang 'khyags pa dang ba mo dang rdul dang na bun du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the ear is bound, it becomes a great stone, ice, a swamp, dust, or mist.

original: dbugs bcings na me'i shing rta dang me'i sgrom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs bcings na me'i shing rta dang me'i sgrom du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nose is bound, it becomes a fire-chariot or a fire-box.

original: ro bcings na du 'bod chen pos smre sngags 'don no //
analyzed: ro bcings na du 'bod chen pos smre sngags 'don no //
translated: If the tongue is bound, it becomes a great cry of woe.

original: reg pa bcings na lus che chung du 'gyur zhing nyin gcig la khri phrag tsam gyi skye 'chi dang gan bub byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa bcings na lus che chung du 'gyur zhing nyin gcig la khri phrag tsam gyi skye 'chi dang gan bub byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body is bound, it becomes a large body, and in one day it experiences birth and death tens of thousands of times, turning over and over.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda!

original: 'di na dmyal ba'i rgyu bcu dang sdig pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di na dmyal ba'i rgyu bcu dang sdig pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa drug ces bya'o //
translated: Here, these are called the ten causes of hell and the six kinds of evil results.

original: 'di dag sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa 'khrul pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa 'khrul pas byas pa yin no //
translated: These are all created by the delusion of ignorance of sentient beings.

original: gal te sems can rnams kyis sdig pa'i las rdzogs par byas na mnar med du skyes nas sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa myong zhing bskal pa grangs med pa 'da' bar byed do //
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams kyis sdig pa'i las rdzogs par byas na mnar med du skyes nas sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa myong zhing bskal pa grangs med pa 'da' bar byed do //
translated: If sentient beings complete evil karma, they are born in Avīci Hell and experience immeasurable suffering, passing countless eons.

original: dbang po drug po rang gis byed @545b pa dang des byas pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po drug po rang gis byed @545b pa dang des byas pa ni /
translated: The six sense faculties and their objects,

original: yul dang dbang po dang bcas na mi 'di mnar med pa'i dmyal ba brgyad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang bcas na mi 'di mnar med pa'i dmyal ba brgyad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if they are all present, this person will be born in the eight great hells.

original: lus ngag yid gsum gyis srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang log par g-yem pa spyad na /
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum gyis srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang log par g-yem pa spyad na /
translated: If one commits killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct with one’s body, speech, and mind,

original: mi 'di dmyal ba bco brgyad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'di dmyal ba bco brgyad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: this person will be born in the eighteen hells.

original: sdig pa rnam pa gsum po cig car du mi byed par 'di las yang na srog gcod pa sna gcig gam ma byin par len pa sna gcig byed na /
analyzed: sdig pa rnam pa gsum po cig car du mi byed par 'di las yang na srog gcod pa sna gcig gam ma byin par len pa sna gcig byed na /
translated: If one does not commit all three of these sins at once, but commits either killing or stealing,

original: mi 'di dmyal ba sum cu rtsa drug tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'di dmyal ba sum cu rtsa drug tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: this person will be born in the thirty-six hells.

original: mthong byed dang mthong bya'i sdig pa sgo gcig gis byed pa dang yang na sdig pa sna gcig byed na /
analyzed: mthong byed dang mthong bya'i sdig pa sgo gcig gis byed pa dang yang na sdig pa sna gcig byed na /
translated: If one commits the sin of seeing and being seen by the same door, or if one commits a single sin,

original: mi 'di dmyal ba brgya rtsa brgyad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'di dmyal ba brgya rtsa brgyad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: this person will be born in the one hundred and eight hells.

original: de'i phyir sems can rnams las so sor byas shing so sor bsags nas 'jig rten spyi mthun gyi gnas su 'jug go /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can rnams las so sor byas shing so sor bsags nas 'jig rten spyi mthun gyi gnas su 'jug go /
translated: Therefore, sentient beings enter the shared world of the environment and its inhabitants through their individual actions and accumulations.

original: thams cad 'khrul pa'i sems las byung ba yin zhing gdod ma nas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad 'khrul pa'i sems las byung ba yin zhing gdod ma nas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: All of this arises from the deluded mind and is not existent from the beginning.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: sems can 'di dag so thar gyi tshul khrims ma nyams pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ma nyams pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la skur pa ma btab pa ma gtogs las phra mo sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu la bskal pa mang por bsregs pa'i 'og tu sdig pa'i las kyi lhag ma zad nas 'dre sna tshogs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag so thar gyi tshul khrims ma nyams pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ma nyams pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la skur pa ma btab pa ma gtogs las phra mo sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu la bskal pa mang por bsregs pa'i 'og tu sdig pa'i las kyi lhag ma zad nas 'dre sna tshogs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: except for those sentient beings who do not violate the rules of individual liberation, who do not violate the bodhisattva precepts, and who do not denigrate nirvāṇa, after being burned for many eons by the results of various subtle actions, when the remainder of their negative karma is exhausted, they are reborn as various types of ghosts.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyu dngos po la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas @546a *//
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyu dngos po la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas @546a *//
translated: Because of their attachment to things, these people, after exhausting the results of their negative actions,

original: dngos po dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la mi sdug pa'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la mi sdug pa'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
translated: encounter things and are reborn as ghosts with physical form, which are called “unattractive ghosts.”

original: gzugs la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas rlung dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la than pa gtong ba'i 'dre zhes bya'o //🔽g-yo sgyu la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas srog chags dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la rmongs byed kyi 'dre zhes bya'o //🔽zhe sdang la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas srin bu dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la srog chags gdug pa'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas rlung dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la than pa gtong ba'i 'dre zhes bya'o // g-yo sgyu la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas srog chags dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la rmongs byed kyi 'dre zhes bya'o // zhe sdang la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas srin bu dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la srog chags gdug pa'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
translated: This being, through his attachment to form, after the exhaustion of his great sin, when he meets with wind, becomes a ghost that causes drought to those who have form.🔽This being, through his attachment to deceit, after the exhaustion of his great sin, when he meets with a living being, becomes a ghost that causes confusion to those who have form.🔽This being, through his attachment to hatred, after the exhaustion of his great sin, when he meets with an insect, becomes a ghost that is a poisonous animal to those who have form.

original: 'khon 'dzin la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas stobs nyams pa dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la rims gtong ba'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khon 'dzin la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas stobs nyams pa dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la rims gtong ba'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
translated: This being, through his attachment to resentment, after the exhaustion of his great sin, when he meets with a weak person, becomes a ghost that causes fever to those who have form.

original: nga rgyal la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu tshe ba zad nas rlangs pa dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la yi dags kyi 'dre zhes bya'o //🔽bsnyon gtong ba la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas mun pa dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la grib gnon gyi 'dre zhes bya'o //🔽lta ba log ba la zhen bas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas gdon dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la the'u rang gi @546b 'dre zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu tshe ba zad nas rlangs pa dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la yi dags kyi 'dre zhes bya'o // bsnyon gtong ba la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas mun pa dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la grib gnon gyi 'dre zhes bya'o // lta ba log ba la zhen bas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas gdon dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la the'u rang gi @546b 'dre zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are attached to pride, when the result of their evil actions is exhausted, and when they meet with steam, become ghosts called “hungry ghosts.”🔽Those who are attached to slander, when the result of their evil actions is exhausted, and when they meet with darkness, become ghosts called “oppressors.”🔽Those who are attached to false views, when the result of their evil actions is exhausted, and when they meet with demons, become ghosts called “demons.”

original: dmod pa la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas snang ba dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la pho nya'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmod pa la zhen pas skye bo 'di sdig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas snang ba dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la pho nya'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are attached to cursing, when the result of their evil actions is exhausted, and when they meet with light, become ghosts called “messengers.”

original: rtsub spyod la zhen pas skye bo 'di smig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas mi dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la khog tu brlams pa'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsub spyod la zhen pas skye bo 'di smig pa'i 'bras bu che ba zad nas mi dang 'phrad nas gzugs su gyur pa rnams la khog tu brlams pa'i 'dre zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are attached to violence, when their great reward of mirage-fruits is exhausted, meet with men and become ghosts in their bellies.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: skye bo 'di dag thams cad sems rkyang pas 'og tu lhung nas rnam smin gyi mes bsregs pa'i rjes su steng du 'ongs nas 'dre ru gyur to //
analyzed: skye bo 'di dag thams cad sems rkyang pas 'og tu lhung nas rnam smin gyi mes bsregs pa'i rjes su steng du 'ongs nas 'dre ru gyur to //
translated: all these ghosts fell down because of their minds alone, and after being burned by the fire of retribution, they came up again and became ghosts.

analyzed: 'di dag thams cad 'khrul pas bsam pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la rgyal chen bzhi'i lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a class is called the gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: rang gi bud med la chags pa srab par gyur cing kun spyod gtsang bar gnas kyang sems tshul gcig tu gnas mi nus pa dag tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu nyi zla'i 'od las 'das nas sa dang 'brel ba'i 'jig rten gyi rtse mor gnas te /
analyzed: rang gi bud med la chags pa srab par gyur cing kun spyod gtsang bar gnas kyang sems tshul gcig tu gnas mi nus pa dag tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu nyi zla'i 'od las 'das nas sa dang 'brel ba'i 'jig rten gyi rtse mor gnas te /
translated: Their attachment to their own women is slight, and they abide in pure conduct, but they are unable to keep their minds focused on a single object. After death, they go beyond the light of the sun and moon and abide at the peak of the world connected to the earth.

analyzed: @550a *// 'di lta bu'i sde la sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a class is called the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: 'dod pa'i yul dang 'phrad na 'phral du 'jug kyang de las 'das na dran bzhin du mi gnas la mi'i 'jig rten la 'dod pa'i rnam rtog rgyu ba nyung zhing mi rgyu ba mang ba dag tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu nam mkha' la rang gi 'od kyis bde
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yul dang 'phrad na 'phral du 'jug kyang de las 'das na dran bzhin du mi gnas la mi'i 'jig rten la 'dod pa'i rnam rtog rgyu ba nyung zhing mi rgyu ba mang ba dag tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu nam mkha' la rang gi 'od kyis bde
translated: They have few thoughts of desire for the human world and many thoughts of not desiring it. After they die and transmigrate, they dwell in the heavens with their own light,

original: bar gnas shing nyi zla'i 'od 'phog par mi 'gyur la 'di dag rang rang gi 'od dang ldan te /
analyzed: bar gnas shing nyi zla'i 'od 'phog par mi 'gyur la 'di dag rang rang gi 'od dang ldan te /

original: 'di lta bu'i sde la 'thab bral gyi lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la 'thab bral gyi lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a group is called the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife.

original: dus rgyun du gtsang bar gnas shing yul la reg pa na chags pa spong mi nus pa dag tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu zab cing rmad du byung ba'i gnas su 'phags nas 'og gi mi dang lha'i gnas las ring du 'das shing 'jig rten 'jig pa'i bskal pa
analyzed: dus rgyun du gtsang bar gnas shing yul la reg pa na chags pa spong mi nus pa dag tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu zab cing rmad du byung ba'i gnas su 'phags nas 'og gi mi dang lha'i gnas las ring du 'das shing 'jig rten 'jig pa'i bskal pa
translated: Those who always dwell in purity and are unable to abandon attachment when they encounter objects, after they die and transmigrate, will ascend to a profound and marvelous abode that is far above the abodes of humans and gods.

original: gsum byung yang de'i gnod pa mi 'byung ste 'di lta bu'i sde la dga' ldan gyi lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsum byung yang de'i gnod pa mi 'byung ste 'di lta bu'i sde la dga' ldan gyi lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Even if three world ages of destruction were to occur, they would not be harmed. Such a group is called the gods of the Heaven of Joy.

original: gzhi nas 'dod pa'i sems med cing gzhan dang 'brel nas nye bar spyad kyang spra tshil gyi ro myong ba ltar gyur pa dag tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu sprul pa'i gnas las 'das shing skye ste 'di lta bu'i sde la 'phrul dga'i lha zhes bya'o //🔽'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i sems med cing 'jig rten dang mthun par spyod kyang de la mi rtog par gnas pa dag tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu sprul pa dang sprul ba med pa'i gnas thams cad las 'das pa @550b ste; 'di lta bu'i sde la gzhan 'phrul dbang

translated: They are no longer attached to the desires of the world, and even though they may still be involved with others, they are like a man who has tasted honey and no longer craves for molasses. After death they leave the realm of the emanations and are reborn in a realm beyond that, which is called the Heaven of Delight in Emanations.

original: byed kyi lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byed kyi lha zhes bya'o //
translated: They are no longer attached to the desires of the world, and even though they may still be involved with others, they are no longer attached to them. After death they leave the realm of the emanations and are reborn in a realm beyond that, which is called the Heaven of Making Free Use of Others’ Emanations.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽lha drug po 'di dag lus 'dod pa'i g-ye ba dang bral yang sems de dang 'brel ba yin no //

translated: Ananda,🔽these six heavens are all still within the realm of desire, even though the inhabitants are no longer attached to the desires of the world.

original: 'di man chad la 'dod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad la 'dod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: From here on is the realm of form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bsgrub pa'i don mngon par thob pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bsgrub pa'i don mngon par thob pa'i rgyu /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa rgya mtsho ston pa /
translated: the teaching of the ocean of conduct of all bodhisattvas;

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gtsug tor dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: the Mahāyāna sūtra called “The Crown of the Buddha, Going with Courage,”

original: bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po dgu pa /
translated: fascicle nine.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'jig rten gyi lam sgom pa po dag ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshul mi sgom na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lam sgom pa po dag ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshul mi sgom na /
translated: if those who cultivate the worldly path do not cultivate the way of entering into samādhi,

original: shes rab 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not attain wisdom.

original: de lta na'ang lus kyi tshul bsdams nas 'dod chags kyi chos mi spyod cing 'gro 'dug kyang mi dran pas 'dod pa'i rnam rtog mi skye'o //

analyzed: 'dod khams su mi chags pas skye bo 'di dag bsam pa bzhin du tshangs ris su skye ste /
translated: Not being attached to the desire realm, these beings are born in the Brahmā group according to their intention.

analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la tshangs ris kyi lha zhes bya'o //

original: 'dod chags kyi bag chags zad cing 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems mngon du gyur nas tshul khrims thams cad la 'dod cing dga' bas rjes su mthun pas skye bo 'di dag dus su tshangs pa'i dpal la spyod de 'di lta bu'i sde la tshangs pa mdun na
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi bag chags zad cing 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems mngon du gyur nas tshul khrims thams cad la 'dod cing dga' bas rjes su mthun pas skye bo 'di dag dus su tshangs pa'i dpal la spyod de 'di lta bu'i sde la tshangs pa mdun na
translated: When the latent tendencies of desire are exhausted and the mind free from desire manifests, one is in accord with all forms of discipline and is thus delighted and pleased.🔽At that time, one experiences the glory of Brahmā.🔽

original: 'don gyi lha zhes bya'o //🔽lus sems kyi brtul @551a *//
analyzed: 'don gyi lha zhes bya'o // lus sems kyi brtul @551a *//
translated: When the habitual tendencies of desire are exhausted and the mind free from desire is manifested, one delights in and is pleased with all forms of moral discipline. original: zhugs rdzogs shing rmad du byung la tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i steng du gsal rig dang ldan na skye bo de dag dus su tshangs ris spyi'i rgyal por gyur te /

translated: When the ascetic practices of body and mind are perfected, and in addition to the purity of moral discipline, one possesses clarity and awareness, these beings become the general king of the Brahmakāyika gods in their time.

original: 'di lta bu'i sde la tshangs chen gyi lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la tshangs chen gyi lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a group is called the Mahābrahmā gods.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la 'od chung gi lha zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la tshad med 'od kyi lha zhes bya'o //

translated: The light rays are emitted pervasively, and the way of the teachings is completely accomplished. The pure precepts are proclaimed, and that way of practice is inexhaustible.

original: 'di lta bu'i sde la 'od gsal gyi lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la 'od gsal gyi lha zhes bya'o //

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: mchog gi gnas 'di gsum yid mi bde ba thams cad kyis mnar bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog gi gnas 'di gsum yid mi bde ba thams cad kyis mnar bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: in these three supreme heavens, the gods are never troubled by any mental anguish.

translated: Although this is not the meditation of perfect cultivation, because the mind is pure and the great defilements are destroyed once and for all, this is called the Second Dhyāna Heaven.
