analyzed: mchog gi gnas bzhi po 'di 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal dang bde ba thams cad kyis bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: these four supreme states cannot be shaken by any suffering or happiness in the world.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mi g-yo ba'i sa ma yin kyang thob pa'i sems yod cing sbyangs pa'i mthu yongs su smin pas 'di la bsam gtan bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mi g-yo ba'i sa ma yin kyang thob pa'i sems yod cing sbyangs pa'i mthu yongs su smin pas 'di la bsam gtan bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Although this is not the immovable stage of the unconditioned, since there is a mind of attainment and the power of cultivation is fully matured, it is called the fourth meditation.

original: kun dga' bo; 'di'i nang du phyir mi ldog pa'i lha lnga yod do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo; 'di'i nang du phyir mi ldog pa'i lha lnga yod do //
translated: Ānanda, there are five gods who do not return here.

original: 'og gi 'jig rten du bag chags rnam pa dgu dus gcig tu thams cad spangs shing sdug bsngal dang bde ba nub nas 'og tu gnas par mi 'os pas de lta bur sems kyi rtog pa spangs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa rnams dang gnas gcig tu gnas so
analyzed: 'og gi 'jig rten du bag chags rnam pa dgu dus gcig tu thams cad spangs shing sdug bsngal dang bde ba nub nas 'og tu gnas par mi 'os pas de lta bur sems kyi rtog pa spangs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa rnams dang gnas gcig tu gnas so
translated: In the lower world, the nine types of habitual tendencies are all abandoned at the same time. After suffering and happiness have disappeared, it is not suitable to remain below. Those of the same fortune who have abandoned such thoughts of the mind dwell in one place.

original: // kun dga' bo /
analyzed: // kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda!

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba thams cad zad na rtsod pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba thams cad zad na rtsod pa'i sems mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When all suffering and happiness are exhausted, the mind of dispute does not arise.

original: 'di lta bu'i sde la mi che ba'i lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la mi che ba'i lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a group is called the Aviha gods.

original: 'jog pa dang sdud pa rang dbang gis 'gro zhing sbyangs te gtan nas ma rnyed na 'di lta bu'i sde la mi gdung ba'i lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jog pa dang sdud pa rang dbang gis 'gro zhing sbyangs te gtan nas ma rnyed na 'di lta bu'i sde la mi gdung ba'i lha zhes bya'o //
translated: If one is able to go, gather, and train with independence and never find anything, such a group is called the Aṭaṭa gods.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su mthong ba rmad du byung ba rnam par dag par rdzogs shing yul gyi gzugs dang sna tshogs pa'i rdul dang dri ma gtan nas med na 'di lta bu'i sde la gya nom snang ba'i lha zhes bya'o //🔽mthong ba dam pa mngon du gyur te sems kyi dbang gis brdzus te skye na yang sgrib pa med na 'di lta bu'i sde la shin tu mthong ba'i @553a *//
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su mthong ba rmad du byung ba rnam par dag par rdzogs shing yul gyi gzugs dang sna tshogs pa'i rdul dang dri ma gtan nas med na 'di lta bu'i sde la gya nom snang ba'i lha zhes bya'o // mthong ba dam pa mngon du gyur te sems kyi dbang gis brdzus te skye na yang sgrib pa med na 'di lta bu'i sde la shin tu mthong ba'i @553a *//
translated: In the worlds of the ten directions, the marvelous vision is pure and perfect. Since there is no trace of the dust and defilements of the objects of form and the various sense-fields, this class is called the gods of Marvelous Appearance.

original: lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha zhes bya'o //
translated: The sublime vision is manifest. Even though one is born spontaneously through the power of the mind, if there is no obstruction, this class is called the gods of Complete Vision.

original: cha phra me'i bar du dpyad nas gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi rang bzhin mthar thug nas mu mtha' med pa'i gnas la sleb pa na 'og min gyi lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cha phra me'i bar du dpyad nas gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi rang bzhin mthar thug nas mu mtha' med pa'i gnas la sleb pa na 'og min gyi lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Having analyzed down to the most subtle part, one reaches the ultimate nature of the essence of form, and when one arrives at the realm without limit, it is called the gods of the Highest Heaven.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i lha 'di dag bsam gtan bzhi la gnas pa'i lha'i rgyal po rnam pa bzhis kyang thos shing dang pa tsam las mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i lha 'di dag bsam gtan bzhi la gnas pa'i lha'i rgyal po rnam pa bzhis kyang thos shing dang pa tsam las mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: these irreversible gods cannot be seen by the four kings of the gods who abide in the four concentrations, except by hearing and believing in them.

original: de lta yang 'jig rten du 'brog dgon pa dang thang dang ri bo'i phug zab mo la sogs pa'i gnas dag tu 'phags pa dgra bcom pa gnas kyang 'jig rten gyi skye bo phal pa rnams kyis mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta yang 'jig rten du 'brog dgon pa dang thang dang ri bo'i phug zab mo la sogs pa'i gnas dag tu 'phags pa dgra bcom pa gnas kyang 'jig rten gyi skye bo phal pa rnams kyis mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: But in the world, in the deserts, on the plains, in the depths of the mountains, there are noble Arhats who are not seen by ordinary people.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: lha ris bco brgyad po 'di dag gcig pu 'dod chags dang bral yang gzugs kyi khur dang ma bral bas 'di dag gzugs kyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha ris bco brgyad po 'di dag gcig pu 'dod chags dang bral yang gzugs kyi khur dang ma bral bas 'di dag gzugs kyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: these eighteen heavens of the world of form, although free from desire, are not free from the burden of form. This is why they are called the world of form.

original: yang kun dga' bo /
analyzed: yang kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gzugs can gyi mthar thug pa'i gnas 'dir lam gnyis su gyes pa yod de /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi mthar thug pa'i gnas 'dir lam gnyis su gyes pa yod de /
translated: at the end of the world of form, there are two paths.

original: gal te btang snyoms kyi sems las ye shes rgyas shing shes rab kyi snang ba rdzogs pa na rdul gyi khams las 'phral du 'das nas dgra bcom par gyur te byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te btang snyoms kyi sems las ye shes rgyas shing shes rab kyi snang ba rdzogs pa na rdul gyi khams las 'phral du 'das nas dgra bcom par gyur te byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, from the mind of equanimity, knowledge develops and the light of wisdom is perfected, then, suddenly passing beyond the realm of form, one becomes an Arhat and enters the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di lta bu'i sde la rigs sad pa'i dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sde la rigs sad pa'i dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a person is called an Arhat who has awakened to the family.

original: gal te btang snyoms kyi sems kyis skyo ba dang btang snyoms grub nas lus la sgrib pa'i rang bzhin du @553b mthong nas sgrib pa de zad cing stong par zhugs pa 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
analyzed: gal te btang snyoms kyi sems kyis skyo ba dang btang snyoms grub nas lus la sgrib pa'i rang bzhin du @553b mthong nas sgrib pa de zad cing stong par zhugs pa 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
translated: If, through a mind of equanimity, one becomes weary and achieves equanimity, and then sees the body as having the nature of obscuration, and that obscuration is exhausted and enters into emptiness, this type of group

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: is called the base of infinite space.

original: gal te sgrib ba zad nas med cing sgrib pa zad pa yang ma dmigs pa las kun gzhi'i rnam shes rdzogs par yod cing yid kyi rnam shes kyi phyogs gcig grub pa 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
analyzed: gal te sgrib ba zad nas med cing sgrib pa zad pa yang ma dmigs pa las kun gzhi'i rnam shes rdzogs par yod cing yid kyi rnam shes kyi phyogs gcig grub pa 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
translated: If, having exhausted obscuration, there is no obscuration, and one does not observe the exhaustion of obscuration, and the foundation consciousness is completely present, and one part of the mental consciousness is established, this type of group

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: is called the base of infinite consciousness.

original: gzugs med cing stong pa'i snang ba yang med la rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'gags nas phyogs bcur dben zhing brten pa'i gnas gtan nas med pa la 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
analyzed: gzugs med cing stong pa'i snang ba yang med la rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'gags nas phyogs bcur dben zhing brten pa'i gnas gtan nas med pa la 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
translated: If there is no form and no appearance of emptiness, and up to consciousness is blocked, and there is no place of isolation and support in the ten directions, this type of group

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: is called the base of nothingness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin mi g-yo zhing 'gag pa'i nus pa mthar gtugs te mi zad pa las zad pa'i rang bzhin bskyed pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin mi g-yo zhing 'gag pa'i nus pa mthar gtugs te mi zad pa las zad pa'i rang bzhin bskyed pa /
translated: The nature of consciousness is unchanging, and its potential to cease is exhausted, yet it is not exhausted. From that, it generates a nature that is exhausted.

original: gnas pa lta yang mi gna shing zad pa lta yang ma zad pa 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
analyzed: gnas pa lta yang mi gna shing zad pa lta yang ma zad pa 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
translated: It does not appear to be abiding, yet it does not appear to be exhausted.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Such a class is called the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di dag la sogs pa stong pa mthar gtugs par 'dod kyang stong pa'i gnas lugs zad par mi nus pas phyir mi ldog pa'i lha las 'phags pa'i lam gyi mthar 'gro ba 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
analyzed: 'di dag la sogs pa stong pa mthar gtugs par 'dod kyang stong pa'i gnas lugs zad par mi nus pas phyir mi ldog pa'i lha las 'phags pa'i lam gyi mthar 'gro ba 'di lta bu'i sde ni /
translated: Even though they desire to reach the end of emptiness, they are unable to exhaust the mode of emptiness. Therefore, they go beyond the path of the non-returners.

original: rigs nges pa'i dgra bcom pa rtul po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs nges pa'i dgra bcom pa rtul po zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a class is called the dull arhat of fixed potential.

original: gal te 'du shes med pa'i lha phyi rol pa'i lta ba can stong pa'i mthar gtugs nas de'i tshul mi gtong bar rmongs te zag pa dang @554a *//
analyzed: gal te 'du shes med pa'i lha phyi rol pa'i lta ba can stong pa'i mthar gtugs nas de'i tshul mi gtong bar rmongs te zag pa dang @554a *//
translated: If the gods of the base of neither perception nor non-perception, who possess the views of non-Buddhists, reach the end of emptiness and do not give up that mode, they will be confused and

original: blo gnyis char nyams pa de dag ni /
analyzed: blo gnyis char nyams pa de dag ni /
translated: their wisdom and both their defilements and antidotes will degenerate.

original: rtag tu 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will always revolve in cyclic existence.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: lha'i nang du gnas pa 'di dag so so skye bo'i las kyi rnam par smin pa rdzogs par myong nas 'khor bar 'khor ro //
analyzed: lha'i nang du gnas pa 'di dag so so skye bo'i las kyi rnam par smin pa rdzogs par myong nas 'khor bar 'khor ro //
translated: these gods who dwell in the heavens experience the ripening of the karma of ordinary beings and then continue to cycle in samsara.

original: lha'i rgyal po de dag rnams byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la rnam par rol zhing rim gyis yar ldan du gyur te 'phags pa'i rigs la phyogs shing spyod pa sgom pa'i lam sgrub bo //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po de dag rnams byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la rnam par rol zhing rim gyis yar ldan du gyur te 'phags pa'i rigs la phyogs shing spyod pa sgom pa'i lam sgrub bo //
translated: These kings of the gods, through the bodhisattva's play in samadhi, gradually increase and turn toward the noble family, practicing the path of cultivation.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: gzugs med kyi lha rigs bzhi po 'di lus dang sems 'gags nas ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin mngon du gyur te las 'bras kyi gzugs med de 'di dag ni /
analyzed: gzugs med kyi lha rigs bzhi po 'di lus dang sems 'gags nas ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin mngon du gyur te las 'bras kyi gzugs med de 'di dag ni /
translated: these four types of formless gods, with body and mind ceased, manifest the nature of samadhi. Formless karma and its results are called

original: gzugs med kyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med kyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: the formless realm.

original: 'di dag thams cad gsal rig rnam par dag pa'i sems mngon par mi shes shing rdzun pa 'dus pa las skye zhing rdzun pa'i khams gsum grub bo //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad gsal rig rnam par dag pa'i sems mngon par mi shes shing rdzun pa 'dus pa las skye zhing rdzun pa'i khams gsum grub bo //
translated: All of these are not aware of the clear, aware, pure mind. They are born from the gathering of lies and the three realms of lies are established.

original: 'di'i nang du rdzun pa'i 'gro ba bdun gyi rjes su 'brangs nas bying bar 'gyur la gang zag rang rang gi rigs dang mthun par spyod do //
analyzed: 'di'i nang du rdzun pa'i 'gro ba bdun gyi rjes su 'brangs nas bying bar 'gyur la gang zag rang rang gi rigs dang mthun par spyod do //
translated: In this way, they are submerged in the seven false paths and act in accordance with their own kind.

original: yang kun dga' bo /
analyzed: yang kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: khams gsum du lha ma yin gyi rigs bzhi yod de /
analyzed: khams gsum du lha ma yin gyi rigs bzhi yod de /
translated: in the three realms there are four kinds of asuras.

original: gal te 'dre'i rigs las chos srung ba'i mthus rdzu 'phrul can du gyur te bar snang la gnas pa 'di lta bu'i lha ma yin ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dre'i rigs las chos srung ba'i mthus rdzu 'phrul can du gyur te bar snang la gnas pa 'di lta bu'i lha ma yin ni /
translated: If, from the kind of ghost, through the power of protecting the Dharma, they become endowed with supernormal powers and live in the sky, such asuras

original: sgo nga las skye zhing 'dre'i phyogs su gtogs so //
analyzed: sgo nga las skye zhing 'dre'i phyogs su gtogs so //
translated: are born from eggs and belong to the class of ghosts.

original: gal @554b te lha'i nang nas dpal nyams shing gnas 'og tu lhung ba dag nyi zla dang gnas mnyam pa 'di lta bu'i lha ma yin ni /
analyzed: gal @554b te lha'i nang nas dpal nyams shing gnas 'og tu lhung ba dag nyi zla dang gnas mnyam pa 'di lta bu'i lha ma yin ni /
translated: If, from among the gods, their glory declines and they fall to a lower abode, but their abode is the same as that of the sun and moon, such asuras

original: mngal las skye zhing mi'i phyogs su gtogs so //
analyzed: mngal las skye zhing mi'i phyogs su gtogs so //
translated: are born from a womb and belong to the class of humans.

original: lha ma yin gyi rgyal po 'ga' zhig 'jig rten skyong zhing mi 'jigs pa'i stobs dang ldan te tshangs pa dang brgya byin dang rgyal po chen po bzhi dag dang yang rtsod par nus pa 'di lta bu'i lha ma yin ni /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi rgyal po 'ga' zhig 'jig rten skyong zhing mi 'jigs pa'i stobs dang ldan te tshangs pa dang brgya byin dang rgyal po chen po bzhi dag dang yang rtsod par nus pa 'di lta bu'i lha ma yin ni /
translated: Some asura kings are world-protectors with the power of fearlessness. They are able to dispute with Brahmā, Śakra, and the Four Great Kings. Such asuras

original: brdzus te skye zhing lha'i phyogs su gtogs so //
analyzed: brdzus te skye zhing lha'i phyogs su gtogs so //
translated: are born supernaturally and belong to the side of the gods.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de dag las lha ma yin rigs dman pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de dag las lha ma yin rigs dman pa dag yod de /
translated: among them there are low-ranking asuras

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i dkyil du skye zhing chu'i klong 'khor gyi sbubs su gnas la nyin mo bar snang la rgyu zhing mtshan mo chu la gnas pa 'di lta bu'i lha ma yin ni /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i dkyil du skye zhing chu'i klong 'khor gyi sbubs su gnas la nyin mo bar snang la rgyu zhing mtshan mo chu la gnas pa 'di lta bu'i lha ma yin ni /
translated: who are born in the middle of the great ocean, live in the depths of the water, move in the sky during the day, and live in the water at night. Such asuras

original: drod gsher las skye zhing dud 'gro'i phyogs su gtogs so //
analyzed: drod gsher las skye zhing dud 'gro'i phyogs su gtogs so //
translated: are born from heat and moisture and belong to the animal realm.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dang / mi dang / yang drang srong dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba bdun po 'di dag gi gnas tshul zhib tu na 'di ltar yin la /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro dang / mi dang / yang drang srong dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba bdun po 'di dag gi gnas tshul zhib tu na 'di ltar yin la /
translated: The seven realms of beings are the hells, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, sages, gods, and demigods.

original: don du na rmongs shing bying bas 'du byas pa'i dngos po phyin pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi 'du shes kyis skye ba len zhing /
analyzed: don du na rmongs shing bying bas 'du byas pa'i dngos po phyin pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi 'du shes kyis skye ba len zhing /
translated: In reality, because of being deluded and confused, one takes birth through distorted perceptions that grasp at substantial things.

original: phyin ci log gi 'du shes kyis las kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi 'du shes kyis las kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: One follows after karma through distorted perceptions.

original: 'di rmad du byung ba'i gsal rig gtan nas ma bcos pa gdod ma'i sems dang bstun na thams cad nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra zhing gdod ma @555a *//
analyzed: 'di rmad du byung ba'i gsal rig gtan nas ma bcos pa gdod ma'i sems dang bstun na thams cad nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra zhing gdod ma @555a *//
translated: When compared to the original mind, which is a wondrous, clear, and ever-present nonfabrication, all of this is like a sky flower.

original: nas gzhi med la stong zhing rdzun pa tsam du zad kyi rtsa ba med do //
analyzed: nas gzhi med la stong zhing rdzun pa tsam du zad kyi rtsa ba med do //
translated: From the beginning, it is groundless, empty, and just false, with no root.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: sems can 'di dag gdod ma'i sems ngo mi shes pa'i phyir 'di ltar 'khor bar 'khor zhing sdig pa'i 'bras bu myong bzhin du bskal pa grangs med pa 'das kyang yang dag pa'i dag pa thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gdod ma'i sems ngo mi shes pa'i phyir 'di ltar 'khor bar 'khor zhing sdig pa'i 'bras bu myong bzhin du bskal pa grangs med pa 'das kyang yang dag pa'i dag pa thob par mi nus so //
translated: These sentient beings, because they do not know the primordial mind, revolve in this way in cyclic existence, and while experiencing the results of evil deeds, they are unable to attain the perfect purity even after passing countless eons.

original: 'di dag srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa'i dbang gis song ba'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa'i dbang gis song ba'i rkyen las byung ba yin no //
translated: These arise from the conditions of taking life, taking what is not given, and going by the power of desire.

original: gsum po 'di las log na srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / 'dod pas log par mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di las log na srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / 'dod pas log par mi spyod pa'o //
translated: If one turns away from these three, one does not take life, does not take what is not given, and does not engage in sexual misconduct.

original: 'di dag yod na /
analyzed: 'di dag yod na /
translated: If these exist,

original: ngan song gi rigs zhes bya la med na mtho ris kyi rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngan song gi rigs zhes bya la med na mtho ris kyi rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called the types of bad migrations; if they do not exist, they are called the types of high status.

original: las de yod med gnyis kyis phan tshun go skabs 'phrog nas 'khor bar 'khor ba'i rang bzhin 'phel la /
analyzed: las de yod med gnyis kyis phan tshun go skabs 'phrog nas 'khor bar 'khor ba'i rang bzhin 'phel la /
translated: By the existence and nonexistence of these actions, they mutually steal the opportunity and the nature of cyclic existence increases.

original: gal te rmad du byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed nus na /
analyzed: gal te rmad du byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed nus na /
translated: If one is able to manifest the marvelous concentration,

original: rtag brtan rmad du byung bar gyur cing yod med thams cad las 'da' bar 'gyur la yod med las 'das pa nyid kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag brtan rmad du byung bar gyur cing yod med thams cad las 'da' bar 'gyur la yod med las 'das pa nyid kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be permanent, stable, and marvelous, and will transcend all existence and nonexistence. Even transcending existence and nonexistence, it will be unobservable.

original: srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / 'dod pas log par mi g-yem pa yin pa la ji ltar srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yod /
analyzed: srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / 'dod pas log par mi g-yem pa yin pa la ji ltar srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yod /
translated: How can there be the activity of killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct when there is no killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct?

original: kun dga' bo /

original: rigs kyi bu gang dag rdzu 'phrul 'dod pa dag gi gam du 'ongs nas stan la 'dug ste chos 'chad cing mi des lag tu me 'bar ba bzung ste cha mang por bgos nas chos nyan pa po 'khor rnam bzhi'i mgo la bzhag cing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gang dag rdzu 'phrul 'dod pa dag gi gam du 'ongs nas stan la 'dug ste chos 'chad cing mi des lag tu me 'bar ba bzung ste cha mang por bgos nas chos nyan pa po 'khor rnam bzhi'i mgo la bzhag cing /
translated: Son of noble family, when those who wish for magical powers come into his presence, he sits on his seat and teaches the Dharma. That person holds a blazing fire in his hand, divides it into many parts, and places it on the heads of the fourfold assembly listening to the Dharma.

original: nyan pa po de dag gi mgor bzhag pa'i me lce 'dom gang tsam du 'bar yang tsha ba'i rang bzhin yang med sreg par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: nyan pa po de dag gi mgor bzhag pa'i me lce 'dom gang tsam du 'bar yang tsha ba'i rang bzhin yang med sreg par yang mi byed do //
translated: Although the tongues of flame placed on the heads of those listening are a fathom in length, they have no nature of heat and do not burn.

original: skabs la lar chu'i steng du sa bde ba la 'gro ba bzhin du 'gro /
analyzed: skabs la lar chu'i steng du sa bde ba la 'gro ba bzhin du 'gro /
translated: In some cases, he walks on water as if on a stable ground.

original: la lar par snang la mi g-yo bar bde bar 'dug /
analyzed: la lar par snang la mi g-yo bar bde bar 'dug /
translated: In some cases, he sits in space without moving.

original: la lar ril pa'i nang du 'jug cing snod chung ngu'i nang du yang 'dug go /
analyzed: la lar ril pa'i nang du 'jug cing snod chung ngu'i nang du yang 'dug go /
translated: In some cases, he enters a needle and also sits in a small vessel.

original: skar khung gi dra mig dang rtsig pa la yang thogs pa med par 'gro ste /
analyzed: skar khung gi dra mig dang rtsig pa la yang thogs pa med par 'gro ste /
translated: He goes without obstruction through windows, lattices, and walls.

original: mtshon cha dang dmag la ni /
analyzed: mtshon cha dang dmag la ni /
translated: With regard to weapons and armies,

original: rang dbang ma thob bo //
analyzed: rang dbang ma thob bo //
translated: he does not obtain independence.

original: rang nyid sangs rgyas su khas 'che zhing gos dkar po gyon nas dge slong gi phyag dang du len /
analyzed: rang nyid sangs rgyas su khas 'che zhing gos dkar po gyon nas dge slong gi phyag dang du len /
translated: They claim to be Buddhas, wear white clothes, and accept the prostrations of monks.

original: bsam gtan dang tshul khrims la skur ba 'debs /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang tshul khrims la skur ba 'debs /
translated: They slander meditation and moral discipline.

original: rab tu byung ba dag la kha zer /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dag la kha zer /
translated: They slander renunciates.

original: skye bo dag la klan ka tshol zhing ngo tsha dang khrel med par spyod do //
analyzed: skye bo dag la klan ka tshol zhing ngo tsha dang khrel med par spyod do //
translated: They seek to find fault with people and behave without shame or embarrassment.

original: ngag @573a *// tu rdzu 'phrul la dbang thob par smra zhing la lar skye bo dag logs shig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing mthong bar byed de /
analyzed: ngag @573a *// tu rdzu 'phrul la dbang thob par smra zhing la lar skye bo dag logs shig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing mthong bar byed de /
translated: They claim to have attained mastery over magical powers, and sometimes they cause people to see a buddha-field elsewhere.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: But these are

original: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin gyi yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin gyi yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: not real, for they are blessed by Māra.

original: des log par g-yem pa la bsngags par byed cing sdig pa chen po la mi 'dzem /🔽ngo tsha dang bral ba'i tshig la chos kyi gtam mo //
analyzed: des log par g-yem pa la bsngags par byed cing sdig pa chen po la mi 'dzem / ngo tsha dang bral ba'i tshig la chos kyi gtam mo //
translated: They praise sexual misconduct and do not avoid great sins.

original: zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes zer te /
translated: They say that words that are devoid of shame are the teachings of the Dharma.

original: 'di la nam mkha' dang sa'i lha mthu bo che dang / ri'i lha dang / mtsho'i lha dang / rlung gi lha dang / chu klung gi lha dang / sa'i lha dang / rtsva shing gi lha bskal pa'i thog ma nas yod pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'di la nam mkha' dang sa'i lha mthu bo che dang / ri'i lha dang / mtsho'i lha dang / rlung gi lha dang / chu klung gi lha dang / sa'i lha dang / rtsva shing gi lha bskal pa'i thog ma nas yod pa rnams dang /
translated: In this regard, there are the powerful gods of space and earth, the gods of mountains, the gods of lakes, the gods of wind, the gods of rivers, the gods of earth, and the gods of grass and trees, who have existed since the beginning of the eon.

original: yang na klu bdud dang drang srong tshe zad nas bdud du gyur pa dang / yang drang srong tshe zad nas 'chi ba la thug pa lus ma brjes par 'dre gzhan de'i lus la zhugs te rgas nas bdud du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na klu bdud dang drang srong tshe zad nas bdud du gyur pa dang / yang drang srong tshe zad nas 'chi ba la thug pa lus ma brjes par 'dre gzhan de'i lus la zhugs te rgas nas bdud du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, there are nāgas, demons, and sages who have exhausted their lifespans and become demons, and also sages who, having exhausted their lifespans, are about to die but, without changing their bodies, enter the body of another and, having aged, become demons.

original: mi de la 'tshe bar byed pa'i tshul des skyo ba'i sems skyes nas de'i lus las bral ba dang slob mar bcas pa la rgyal po'i chad pa phog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi de la 'tshe bar byed pa'i tshul des skyo ba'i sems skyes nas de'i lus las bral ba dang slob mar bcas pa la rgyal po'i chad pa phog par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that method of harming people, a mind of weariness arises, and they separate from that body. Then, together with their disciples, they are punished by the king.

original: khyed cag thog ma nas rig na 'khor bar mi 'jug la 'khrul zhing bslus pas ma rig na mnar med pa'i dmyal bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: khyed cag thog ma nas rig na 'khor bar mi 'jug la 'khrul zhing bslus pas ma rig na mnar med pa'i dmyal bar ltung ngo //
translated: If you were aware from the beginning, you would not enter saṃsāra. If, deluded and deceived, you are unaware, you will fall into the Avīci hell.
